464.description: Revises exemption from licensure related to low-voltage electrical work performed by certain persons & entities; exempts from licensure certain employees & sales representatives of alarm system contractors; provides for construction; provides definitions; provides for applicability; requires local enforcement agencies to offer for sale uniform basic permit labels to contractors for specified cost; requires contractors to post unused label in specified place before commencing work on low-voltage alarm system project; requires contractors to submit specified form within specified period; prescribes form for such notice; provides inspection procedures & requirements for low-voltage alarm system projects; prohibits specified local governments from adopting or maintaining certain ordinances & rules; provides that additional uniform basic permit label shall not be required to perform work on certain alarm systems; provides for applicability.

465.title: Archeological Sites and Specimens
465.description: Authorizes DOS' Division of Historical Resources to issue permits for excavation, surface reconnaissance, & archaeological activities on land owned by water authorities; provides that specified activities relating to archaeological sites & specimens located upon land owned or controlled by water authorities are prohibited & subject to penalties; authorizes division to impose administrative fine on & seek injunctive relief against certain entities.

466.title: St. Lucie County Mosquito Control District, St. Lucie County

467.title: Fort Pierce Farms Water Control District, St. Lucie County
467.description: Codifies charter for Fort Pierce Farms Water Control District; amends, codifies, repeals, & reenacts all special acts relating to district as single act; repeals various chapters relating to district.

468.title: North St. Lucie River Water Control District, St. Lucie County
468.description: Codifies special acts relating to district; provides charter; provides boundaries & purpose; provides for governing board & its membership, compensation, & duties; provides requirements for financial disclosure, meeting notices, reporting, public records maintenance, per diem expenses, issuance of bonds, & elections; authorizes levy of taxes, non-ad valorem assessments, fees, & service charges; provides for future termination; provides for construction & severability.

469.title: Court-Ordered Expunction of Criminal History Records
469.description: Requires FDLE to disclose contents of expunged criminal history record to subject of record or Parole Commission.

470.title: Small Business Participation in State Contracting
470.description: Directs that agencies avoid contract bundling under certain circumstances; requires agencies to conduct market research & include written summaries & analyses of such research in solicitations for bundled contracts; requires agencies to award a specified percentage of contracts to small businesses; requires contract vendors to use small businesses in the state as subcontractors or subvendors; provides requirements with respect to payment of subcontractors; prohibits agencies, general contractors, or prime contractors from requiring certain bonds or other sureties for certain contracts; requires the rules ombudsman in the EOG to establish a system for reporting small business participation in state contracting; requiring agencies to cooperate with such reporting; requires specified annual reports.

471.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 628 (Ch. 2013-67)
471.title: Driver Licenses
471.description: Authorizes justice, judge, or designated employee to access reproductions of driver license images as part of official work of court; revises & clarifies provisions.

472.title: School Emergency Procedures
472.description: Distinguishes emergency lockdown drills from emergency evacuation drills; provides requirements for conducting emergency lockdown drills; requires schools to submit after-drill reports to school district.

473.title: Pub. Rec./School District After-Drill Report
473.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for school district's after-drill report that summarizes emergency drills of each school in district & recommendations from participating law enforcement officers or fire officials; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

474.title: Regulation of Firearms and Ammunition
474.description: Provides that, except as otherwise expressly prohibited by State Constitution, county or municipality may regulate possession of firearms on property owned by such municipality or county.

475.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 736 (Ch. 2013-234)
475.title: Conveyances of Real Property
475.description: Provides that specified period after recording of certain instruments from which it appears that person owning real property attempted to convey, affect, or devise property, instrument shall be held to have its purported effect; provides that power of attorney validated under this provision is only valid for purpose of effectuating instrument with which it was recorded; provides period for making claim or defense in court to determine validity or invalidity of instrument that may be affected by amendments made by this act.

477.title: Environmental Regulation
477.description: Creates, amends, & revises numerous provisions relating to: development permit applications; marinas, boatyards, & marine retailers; general permits for special events; well permits; recovered materials dealers; exemptions from permits, fees & related environmental requirements & regulation; major sources of air pollution; restoration of seawalls; & state-owned land leases.

479.title: Prescription Drug Benefit Plans
479.description: Creates specialty tier prescription drug moratorium & study; requires report to Governor & Legislature.

480.title: Motorist Safety
480.description: Authorizes governing body of county to create yellow dot critical motorist medical information program to assist emergency medical responders by making critical medical information readily available to responders in event of motor vehicle accident or medical emergency involving a participant's vehicle; authorizes county to solicit sponsorships for program & enter into interlocal agreement with another county to solicit such sponsorships.

481.title: Lee County Tourist Development Council, Lee County
481.description: Revises council membership; provides exception to general law.

482.title: Fellsmere Water Control District, Indian River County
482.description: Codifies, amends, reenacts, & repeals certain chapters of LOF relating to Fellsmere Water Control District, Indian River County; renames district Fellsmere Improvement District; provides legislative intent; provides additional authority relating to provision of public infrastructure, services, assessment, levy, & collection of non-ad valorem assessments & fees, public finance, & district operations; provides district boundaries; provides for applicability of ch. 298, F.S., & other general laws; provides powers of district; provides for compliance with county & municipal plans & regulations; provides for levy of non-ad valorem assessments; provides for collection, enforcement, & penalties; provides for issuance of revenue bonds, assessment bonds, & bond anticipation notes; ratifies prior acts & circuit court decrees; provides for severability.

483.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
483.title: Broward County/Municipal Special Assessments for Law Enforcement Services
483.description: Authorizes municipalities in county to levy special assessments to fund law enforcement services; provides for reduction in ad valorem assessments.

484.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-259, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 954 (Ch. 2013-235)
484.title: Technological Research & Development Authority, Brevard County
484.description: Abolishes TRDA; transfers authority's assets & indebtedness to Brevard County.

485.last_action: Died in Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
485.title: State Ombudsman Program
485.description: Reorganizes long-term ombudsman services; provides duties of Office of State Long-Term Care Ombudsman & State Long-Term Care Ombudsman Council; provides conditions under which representative of office could be found to have conflict of interest; provides immunity from liability for representative of office; requires long-term care facilities to provide representatives of office with access to facilities, residents, & records for certain purposes; provides for office to coordinate ombudsman services with Disability Rights Florida.

488.title: Background Screening
488.description: Allows DHSMV to share driver license photographs with AHCA pursuant to interagency agreement; adds additional disqualifying offenses to screening provisions; revises information to be submitted for background screening; revises terminology; requires that individuals seeking exemption from disqualification must have completed all nonmonetary conditions; requires persons seeking exemption from disqualification to pay any monetary penalty in full before being eligible to apply; requires that photograph of applicant taken at time fingerprints are processed be submitted to Care Provider Background Screening Clearinghouse before submission of electronic fingerprints; requires specified information to be included with initiation of screening registration within clearinghouse.

490.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1398 (Ch. 2013-182)
490.title: Real Estate Appraisers
490.description: Revises terminology applicable to education requirements for registered trainee appraisers, certified residential appraisers, & certified general appraisers; authorizes qualifying education courses completed by applicants for registration as trainee or certification as residential appraiser or general appraiser to be completed through Internet-based instruction; revises education & experience requirements for certified residential appraisers & certified general appraisers according to certain real property appraiser qualification criteria adopted by Appraiser Qualifications Board of Appraisal Foundation on specified date; authorizes certain schools to provide in-person classroom instruction, Internet-based instruction, or both; provides requirements for Internet-based instruction & course examinations.

491.title: Broward County Education, Research, and Training Authority, Broward County
491.description: Abolishes Broward County Education, Research, & Training Authority; transfers the authority's assets & liabilities.

492.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
492.title: Space Exploration
492.description: Requires Florida Institute of Technology to submit plan to DEO in order to qualify for grant funding of space exploration research laboratory; requires certain information to be included in plan; requires institute to annually submit report relating to expenditures & accomplishments of space exploration research laboratory; specifies information for inclusion in annual report; requires institute to enter into contract containing certain terms with DEO; provides for funding to cease; requires DEO to make annual reviews & recommendations concerning whether to continue funding space exploration research laboratory; directs DOR, after notice by DEO that certain contingencies have been met, to annual distribute for number of years specified amount of funds generated by visitor activity at Kennedy Space Center & Cape Canaveral Air Force Station for purpose of establishing & operating space exploration research institute at Florida Institute of Technology.

493.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1388 (Ch. 2013-237)
493.title: Instructional Materials for K-12 Public Education
493.description: Revises duties of district school board & superintendent for providing instructional materials; requires instructional materials to align with state standards; revises instructional materials review & approval process; revises duties of publishers & manufacturers of instructional materials; revises use of funds allocated for instructional materials.

494.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1096 (Ch. 2013-35), CS/CS/SB 1664 (Ch. 2013-185)
494.title: Public School Classroom Teachers
494.description: Renames Florida Teachers Lead Program as Florida Teachers Classroom Supply Assistance Program; provides for local contributions to program; requires identification of debit cards used as method of payment to teachers; authorizes public-private partnerships to increase total amount of funds available.

495.title: Premises Liability
495.description: Revises term "outdoor recreational purposes" to include noncommercial aviation activities.

496.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
496.title: School Zero-Tolerance Policies
496.description: Requires that school zero tolerance policies only require reporting of acts that poses serious threat to school safety to law enforcement & to otherwise handle acts within their own disciple systems; provides requirements for referrals of juveniles to criminal or juvenile justice systems for petty acts of misconduct or misdemeanors; requires school districts to assign expelled students to disciplinary program during period of expulsion; revises requirements for agreements between school districts & law enforcement agencies; requires that certain polices be provided to DOE annually; provides for model policy; making distribution of certain funds contingent on compliance with specified procedures; requires an annual report by commissioner of Education; requires approval of certain policies in order to receive certain funds; provides that certain funds may be used for specified activities.

498.title: Health Education
498.description: Requires students to earn one-half credit in health education, independent of physical education credit requirement, for high school graduation; authorizes waiver from requirement; reduces number of required credits in elective courses.

500.title: Defense of Life, Home, & Property
500.description: Provides that defensive display of weapon or firearm, including discharge of firearm for purpose of warning shot, does not constitute use of deadly force; provides immunity from prosecution for persons acting in defense of life, home, & property from violent attack or threat of violent attack through certain displays of or uses of force; limits specified provision authorizing use of deadly force by law enforcement or correctional officers; provides exemption from minimum sentence requirements related to use of weapon or firearm for persons acting in self-defense or defense of others; authorizes departure from minimum sentence requirements related to use of weapon or firearm for persons convicted of certain offenses who were not immune from prosecution but who meet specified requirements.

501.last_action: Died pending review of CS, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7019 (Ch. 2013-213)
501.title: Sports Facilities
501.description: Authorizes boards of county commissioners to include certain commercial developments in lease agreements related to professional sports franchise facilities; provides exemption from sales & use tax for building materials used in construction, reconstruction, expansion, or renovation of certain certified motorsports entertainment complexes through refund of previously paid taxes; provides procedures for applying for authority to earn tax refund; provides procedures for certifying refund for completed projects; provides procedures for applying for refund; provides audit authority & procedures for recapturing refunds; provides for reductions in certain local government half-cent sales tax distributions; provides for monthly distribution of specified amount of sales tax revenue to certain facilities certified by DEO as meeting requirements for receiving such funds; provides for applicability of specified statutory provisions with respect to funding of certified applicant's facility; authorizes applicant previously certified as facility for new or retained professional sports franchise to receive additional certification; revises requirements for certification of facility as motorsports entertainment complex by DEO.

502.title: Sale or Transfer of Firearms at Gun Shows
502.description: Prohibits any person other than licensed dealer from being gun show vendor; prohibits sale or transfer of weapon at gun show unless licensed dealer is party to transaction.

503.last_action: Withdrawn prior to introduction, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1770 (Ch. 2013-60)
503.title: Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund
503.description: Revises definitions of terms "covered policy," "retention," & "corporation"; provides for calculation of insurer's reimbursement premium & retention under reimbursement contract; revises coverage levels available under reimbursement contract; revises aggregate coverage limits; provides for phase-in of changes to coverage levels & limits; changes name of Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund Finance Corporation; repeals provisions relating to temporary emergency options for additional coverage; provides for recoupment of certain costs of reinsurance.

504.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7007 (Ch. 2013-39)
504.title: Reemployment Assistance Appeals Commission
504.description: Transfers & reassigning functions & responsibilities of Reemployment Assistance Appeals Commission to DEO; requires that Governor submit information & obtain waivers as required by federal law; authorizes Governor to transfer funds & positions between agencies upon approval from Legislative Budget Commission; deletes provisions relating to reemployment assistance appeals commission & providing for establishment of regional appeals offices; provides DEO with certain responsibilities relating to appeals offices; provides for appointment of appeals referees & alternates; provides duties & powers of regional workforce boards; provides for review panels; provides for establishment of central appeal office for certain purposes; provides filing requirements for notice of appeal; provides duties of review panel & department; revises criteria for determining an applicant's availability for work; provides application; provides for transfer of funds from Audit & Warrant Clearing Trust Fund to Unemployment Compensation Trust Fund under certain conditions; provides that department shall have ultimate authority over administration of reemployment assistance program.

506.last_action: Died in Appropriations Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7125 (Ch. 2013-160)
506.title: Traffic Control
506.description: Revises provisions for enforcement of traffic control signals using traffic infraction detector; prohibits notice of violation or traffic citation for right on red violation; revises provisions for hearings; requires traffic control signals to maintain certain signal intervals & display durations based on posted speeds.

507.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Appropriations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 948 (Ch. 2013-177)
507.title: Water Supply
507.description: Revises legislative intent with regard to water supply policy, planning, production, & funding; requires water management districts to assist private landowners & self-suppliers in meeting certain water supply needs & to coordinate with private landowners & DACS for regional water supply planning; authorizes water management districts to contract with such entities for specified purposes; clarifies funding assistance eligibility criteria for certain water supply development projects; provides criteria & requirements for determining agricultural water supply demand projections; requires DACS to establish agricultural water supply planning program.

508.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
508.title: Reemployment Assistance
508.description: Defines "an organization that is operated primarily for religious purposes"; requires DEO to adopt procedural rules governing application & review of organization requests for classification as organization that is operated primarily for religious purposes.

509.title: Pugilistic Exhibitions
509.description: Revises duties & responsibilities of executive director of Florida State Boxing Commission; deletes provision requiring electronic recording of all scheduled commission proceedings; provides commission exclusive jurisdiction over approval of amateur mixed martial arts matches; deletes provisions for licensure of concessionaires; provides for immediate license suspension & other disciplinary action if participant fails or refuses to provide urine sample or tests positive for specified prohibited substances; revises procedure & requirements for requesting hearing following withholding of purse; requires promoters to retain specified documents & records; authorizes commission & DBPR to audit specified records retained by promoter; revises procedure for suspension of licenses; revises rules of procedure governing commission hearings; provides appropriation. APPROPRIATION:

510.title: Emerald Coast Utilities Authority, Escambia County
510.description: Revises frequency of management efficiency audit.

511.title: Health Care Accrediting Organizations
511.description: Conforms provisions to revised definition of term "accrediting organizations," as amended by s. 4, ch. 2012-66, LOF, for purposes of hospital licensing & regulation by AHCA; specifies accrediting agencies for physical therapist assistant programs.

512.title: Service Animals
512.description: Creates "Dawson and David Caras Act"; provides rights for individual accompanied by service animal; provides that documentation that service animal is trained is not precondition for providing certain services to individual accompanied by service animal; provides restrictions for public accommodation imposing deposit or surcharge; provides for liability of individual accompanied by or trainer of service animal; provides responsibility for supervision of service animal; provides conditions for exclusion or removal of service animal from public accommodation; provides penalty for denying or interfering with right to public accommodation; provides for rights to housing accommodations for owner of service animal; provides limitations; provides rights of housing to owner or trainer of service animal; provides rights to trainer of service animals; provides penalty for misrepresentation as trainer.

514.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 390 (Ch. 2013-126)
514.title: Veterans' Charitable Organizations or Sponsors
514.description: Provides that is it unlawful for person in connection with planning, conduct, or execution of solicitation or charitable or sponsor sales promotion to falsely state that he or she is member of or represents veterans' charitable organization or sponsor in certain circumstances or is member of or represents law enforcement or emergency service organization; subjects violators to penalties.

515.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1300 (Ch. 2013-180)
515.title: Limited Liability Companies
515.description: Creates ch. 605, "Florida Revised Limited Liability Company Act" to replace current Florida Limited Liability Company Act; provides for applicability of & transition from current act to revised act; provides for future repeal of current act.

516.title: Discretionary Sales Surtaxes
516.description: Authorizes county school board to use school surtax to purchase school buses.

517.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-205, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1085 (Ch. 2013-206)
517.title: Underground Natural Gas Storage
517.description: Declares underground natural gas storage to be in public interest; provides for notice & permitting of storage in & recovery from natural gas storage reservoirs; provides for expedited permitting of such facilities & certain projects; authorizes DEP to issue permits to establish natural gas storage facilities; provides for legal action against persons who appear to be violating rules relating to natural gas storage & recovery; directs DEP to adopt rules before issuing permits for natural gas storage facilities.

518.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-206, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1083 (Ch. 2013-205)
518.title: Public Records/Natural Gas Storage Facility Permit
518.description: Creates exemption from public records requirements for proprietary business information provided in application for natural gas storage facility permit to inject & recover gas into & from natural gas storage reservoir; authorizes specified disclosure of such information; provides for future review & repeal of public records exemption under the Open Government Sunset Review Act; provides statement of public necessity.

519.title: Substance Abuse Services
519.description: Defines "sober house transitional living home" as it relates to Hal S. Marchman Alcohol & Other Drug Services Act; requires applicants seeking licensure to adhere to certain zoning & occupancy standards & provide written notice before receiving licensure as provider; requires a sober house transitional living home in existence on certain date to apply for licensure & give notice to local government by specified date; provides for conflict resolution by informal mediation; provides that local government is not precluded from adopting ordinances that govern facilities that offer substance abuse services.

520.title: Banking
520.description: Clarifies that institution may impose fee for settlement of check; provides legislative intent; provides that financial institution is not civilly liable solely for extending loan or line of credit.

521.title: Volunteer Health Services
521.description: Revises criteria required for limited licensure for physicians; revises requirements for patient referral under "Access to Health Care Act"; eliminating requirement that governmental contractor approve all followup or hospital care; requires DOH to post specified information online concerning volunteer providers; permits volunteer providers to earn continuing education credit for participation in program up to specified amount; provides that rules adopted by DOH give providers greatest flexibility possible in order to serve eligible patients.

522.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
522.title: English Language Instruction
522.description: Provides that student's parent has right to request that student be exempted from instruction in English language proficiency; requires school district to exempt student from participating in instruction in English language proficiency if student's parent requests exemption in writing.

525.title: Residential Foreclosure Proceedings
525.description: Provides short title; defines term "mortgage collection firm"; prohibits mortgage collection firm from offering false evidence in mortgage foreclosure proceeding; provides that violation is deceptive & unfair trade practice; provides penalties & remedies; provides for award of attorney fees & costs under certain circumstances.

526.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
526.title: Driver Licenses and Driving Privileges
526.description: Creates "Driver's Accountability Act"; provides alternative to payment of criminal penalty when court finds violator has an inability to pay; revises penalty provisions relating to driving while license suspended, revoked, canceled, or disqualified; revises provisions for DHSMV to suspend license of person who has failed to pay financial obligation for criminal offense.

528.last_action: Died in Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
528.title: Transitional Living Facilities
528.description: Provides requirements for transitional living facilities including license applications, applications and fees, client admission, transfer, & discharge, individual treatment plans & client services, provider responsibilities, medication practices, client safety, background screening, property & personal affairs of clients, & receivership proceedings; provides criminal penalties for violations; provides rulemaking authority; provides for classification of deficiencies; requires AHCA to develop electronic systems for certain purposes; repeals provisions relating to transitional living facilities.

529.last_action: Died in Veteran and Military Affairs Subcommittee
529.title: Department of Veterans' Affairs
529.description: Exempts Grants & Donations Trust Fund & State Homes for Veterans Trust Fund administered by DVA from provisions authorizing Legislature to transfer unappropriated cash balances in funds to General Revenue Fund & Budget Stabilization Fund.

530.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
530.title: Postsecondary Student Tuition
530.description: Provides additional category of nonresident persons exempt from paying nonresident tuition at state university or Florida College System institution.

531.title: Pub. Rec./Dental Workforce Surveys
531.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information contained in dental workforce surveys submitted by dentists or dental hygienists to DOH; provides exceptions to exemption; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

532.last_action: Died in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
532.title: County Contributions to Medicaid Program
532.description: Creates study group to evaluate percentage of funds that counties are required to contribute to Medicaid program & provide recommendations to Governor & Legislature.

533.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 142 (Ch. 2013-162)
533.title: Intellectual Disabilities
533.description: Substitutes Arc of Florida for Association for Retarded Citizens for purposes of certain proceedings relating to children; substitutes term "intellectual disability" for "mental retardation"; clarifies in specified provisions that meaning of terms "intellectual disability" or "intellectually disabled" is same as meaning of terms "mental retardation," "retarded," & "mentally retarded" for purposes of matters relating to criminal laws & court rules.

534.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
534.title: Community Cats
534.description: Provides that release of community cat by community cat program is not abandonment or unlawful release of cat under specified provisions; provides that counties & municipalities may enact ordinances relating to community cat programs to curtail community cat population growth; provides immunity for such ordinances; provides exception.

535.title: Employers and Employees
535.description: Creates civil cause of action for wage theft; provides jurisdiction; provides procedure for filing of civil action for wage theft; provides jurisdiction; provides limitation on filing fee; requires claimant to notify employer of employee's intention to initiate civil action; provides employer specific time to resolve action; provides statute of limitations; requires claimant to prove wage theft by preponderance of evidence; provides limitation for compensatory damages; prohibits certain damages; authorizes county, municipality, or political subdivision to establish process by which claim may be filed; prohibits local government from adopting or maintaining in effect certain laws, ordinances, and rules for purpose of addressing unpaid wage claims; prohibits preemption of certain local ordinances governing wage theft; provides that any regulation, ordinance, or other provision for recovery of unpaid wages is prohibited & preempted to state.

536.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
536.title: Pet Services and Welfare Programs
536.description: Authorizes counties to create independent special districts to provide funding for pet services & welfare programs; creates Pets' Trust council.

537.title: Infants Born Alive
537.description: Provides that infant born alive during or immediately after attempted abortion is entitled to same rights, powers, & privileges as any other child born alive in course of natural birth; requires health care practitioners to preserve life & health of such infant born alive, if possible; provides for transport & admittance of infant to hospital; requires health care practitioner or employees who have knowledge of any violations with respect to infants born alive after attempted abortion to report those violations to DOH; provides penalty; provides for construction; revises reporting requirements.

538.title: Required Instruction in the Public Schools
538.description: Cites act as "Character Education Act"; revises curriculum of character-development program required in kindergarten through grade 12.

539.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
539.title: Public Data
539.description: Requires each agency to submit inventory of public data to Secretary of State; requires Secretary of State to establish website by specified date; authorizes the DOS to use fees in Records Management Trust Fund for administration of website.

540.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
540.title: Telecommunications Access System
540.description: Revises powers & duties of PSC; requires that commission establish recovery mechanism requiring commercial mobile radio service providers to impose monthly surcharge on their subscribers; revises provisions relating to administration; provides for distribution of wireless mobile devices; revises membership of advisory committee that assists commission; requires that commission ensure public safety & health care providers are complying with requirements to purchase & operate telecommunications devices.

541.title: High School Athletics
541.description: Revises provisions relating to FHSAA, including bylaws relating to student residence & transfer approvals, student ineligibility to participate in competition, & investigations into ineligibility to participate; revises composition of FHSAA board of directors.

542.title: Medical Cannabis
542.description: Authorizes qualifying patient to possess & administer medical cannabis, & possess & use paraphernalia for specified purpose; authorizes patient's caregiver to possess & administer medical cannabis to qualifying patient & to possess & use paraphernalia for specified purpose; provides procedures & requirements thereto; provides that act does not allow person to undertake task under influence of medical cannabis when doing so constitutes negligence or malpractice; provides that use of medical cannabis does not create defense to certain offenses; authorizes physician to recommend use of medical cannabis; provides procedures & requirements thereto; requires DBPR to regulate licensure of cultivation centers & dispensaries; provides procedures & requirements thereto; prohibits school, employer, or property owner from refusing to enroll, employ, or lease to or penalize person who is cardholder; requires DOH, DBPR, & DOR to adopt rules by specified date; establishing medical cannabis section within DBPR; provides procedures & requirements; authorizes medical cannabis farm to possess, cultivate, & manufacture medical cannabis, medical cannabis-based products, & marijuana plants for wholesale in this state; requires agricultural classification for land used as medical cannabis farm; prohibits medical cannabis farm from conducting retail sales or transactions; provides certain protections to medical cannabis farms; provides permitting procedures and fees; provides licensing procedures and fees; requires reporting of loss, theft, or unexplained shortage of medical cannabis product to local law enforcement agency & department; authorizes administrative fines, license suspension, injunctive relief.

543.title: Screening of Direct Service Transit Providers & Volunteers
543.description: Requires direct service transit providers to submit to background screening.

544.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
544.title: Motor Vehicle Dealers
544.description: Defines "independent motor vehicle sales agent"; provides requirements to obtain independent motor vehicle sales agent license; provides fee for licensure.

545.title: State-Owned or State-Leased Space
545.description: Revises provisions relating to inventory of state-owned facilities; clarifies that deeds may be signed by agents of Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund; revises provisions relating to decisions by board for surplus lands; revises responsibilities of DMS with respect to state-owned buildings; authorizes state agencies to use services of tenant broker to provide certain information; requires all state-owned facilities to report energy consumption & cost data.

546.title: Office of Attorney General
546.description: Revises Legal Affairs Revolving Trust Fund with regard to which funds are required to be transferred to General Revenue Fund unallocated; provides that rewards for reporting Medicaid fraud shall be paid from Operating Trust Fund; revises obsolete dates; revises duties of Department of Legal Affairs relating to manufacturer certification of dispute-settlement procedures; provides notice requirements for certain manufacturers seeking renewal of certification or ceasing operation of certified procedure; revises notice requirements relating to rejection of dispute by department; authorizes, rather than requiring, office to bring an action for complaints involving discriminatory housing practices.

547.last_action: Died in Appropriations Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1300 (Ch. 2013-180)
547.title: Business Entity Filing Fees
547.description: Combines certain individual fees into one initial filing fee, revises fees, & requires imposition of late charge under certain circumstances for corporation for profit, LLC, corporation not for profit, domestic limited partnership, & foreign limited partnership, respectively; revises fees & requires imposition of late charge under certain circumstances for limited liability partnership; repeals s. 607.193, F.S., relating to supplemental corporate fees.

548.title: Renters' Insurance
548.description: Requires residential rental agreement to specify whether renters' insurance is required; requires agreement that requires renters' insurance to specify coverage required & to provide signature line; requires tenant to sign signature line for provision to be enforceable; requires that agreement that does not require renters' insurance include statement advising tenant to obtain renters' insurance.

550.title: Coverage For Mental and Nervous Disorders
550.description: Revises requirements & limitations for optional coverage for mental & nervous disorders; authorizes insurer or HMO to take certain steps to reduce service costs; specifies nonapplicability; repeals provisions relating to optional coverage required for substance abuse impaired persons; requires OIR to submit report to Legislature containing specified information; provides for applicability.

551.title: Health Flex Plans
551.description: Revises definition of terms "health care coverage" or "health flex plan coverage" to include certain specified benefits; deletes section's expiration date.

553.title: Clinical, Counseling, & Psychotherapy Services
553.description: Revises provisions relating to licensure & regulation of clinical social workers, marriage & family therapists, & mental health counselors; revises provisions relating to interns & provisional licensees in mental health profession.

554.title: The Florida Marriage Handbook
554.description: Creates Marriage Education Committee; provides for membership & terms of members; provides for administration within DCF; provides for creation of Florida Marriage Handbook; provides topics that may be covered; requires committee to obtain private funds for certain expenses; provides for distribution of handbook & encourages clerks of court to provide list of course providers & sites where marriage & relationship skill-building classes are available; provides for review & revision of handbook; requires marriage license applications to provide applicants with opportunity to receive electronic copy of handbook.

555.last_action: Died in Rulemaking Oversight and Repeal Subcommittee
555.title: Ratification of Rules Implementing Workers' Compensation Law
555.description: Ratifies specified rule implementing Workers' Compensation Law for sole & exclusive purpose of satisfying any condition on effectiveness that requires ratification of any rule meeting any of specified thresholds for likely adverse impact or increase in regulatory costs.

556.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
556.title: City of Jacksonville, Duval County
556.description: Revises membership of Jacksonville Police & Fire Pension Board of Trustees; requires board to submit budget to city council.

557.title: St. Lucie and Martin Counties
557.description: Revises provisions for temporary distribution from Martin County to St. Lucie County of certain tax & assessment revenue collected in portion of St. Lucie County being incorporated into Martin County; exempts certain revenue from distribution to St. Lucie County; revises annual date of such distributions.

558.title: Florida Communications Fraud Act
558.description: Provides limitations period for civil & criminal actions under that act; provides that in criminal proceeding period does not run during any time defendant is absent from state or without reasonably ascertainable place of abode or work within state; limits amount of such exception; reclassifies offense of communications fraud with value greater than $50,000 on offense severity ranking chart.

559.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
559.title: Broward County
559.description: Creates "School Safety Act of Broward County"; creates independent special district to provide school security & mental health referral services for students and staff; provides for governing board, Broward School Safety Board; provides for ad valorem assessment; requires referendum.

560.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
560.title: Mortgage Loan Servicing
560.description: Creates "Florida Homeowners Bill of Rights Act"; provides procedures, requirements, & limitations with respect to mortgage servicer's processing of borrower's application for modification of mortgage loan as foreclosure prevention alternative; requires mortgage servicer to provide single point of contract for mortgage borrower seeking mortgage modification; requires single point of contact to engage in specified activities & perform certain services with respect to borrowers; provides requirements & procedures with respect to borrower's request for short sale of mortgaged property; provides requirements, procedures, & limitations with respect to mortgage servicer's obtaining of force-placed insurance coverage on borrower's mortgaged property; defines "robo-signed" or "robo-signing"; provides for imposition of civil penalties against any mortgage servicer who engages in robo-signing; provides for private causes of action for material violations of act by mortgage servicers; provides for statutory & actual damages & attorney fees & costs in such actions.

561.title: Florida Retirement System
561.description: Provides that employee contributions to retirement system must only be made by employees who were hired on or after July 1, 2011.

562.title: Substance Abuse Treatment Services
562.description: Designates act "The Jennifer Act"; revises filing fee for involuntary admissions proceedings for substance abuse treatment; provides for distribution of proceeds from fee; increases period allowed for assessment of person following involuntary custody or admission to hospital or other facility; specifies requirements for initial processing of inmates by DOC for substance abuse needs; provides that, to fullest extent practicable, inmates be given choice between faith-based & nonfaith-based substance abuse programs.

563.title: Pub. Rec./Forensic Behavioral Health Evaluations
563.description: Creates exemption from public records requirements for forensic behavioral health evaluation filed with court; defines "forensic behavioral health evaluation"; authorizes release of such evaluations; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption under Open Government Sunset Review Act; provides statement of public necessity, applicability, & construction.

564.title: Pub. Rec./Participants in Treatment-Based Drug Court Programs
564.description: Exempts from public records requirements initial screenings for treatment-based drug court program, substance abuse screenings, behavioral health evaluations, & subsequent treatment status reports regarding participant in treatment-based drug court program; provides for future repeal & legislative review of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

565.last_action: Died in Business and Professional Regulation Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7023 (Ch. 2013-251)
565.title: Deregulation of Professions and Occupations
565.description: Exempts certain auctioneers who conduct motor vehicle auction contests from licensure; deletes licensure requirements for auctioneer apprentices; deletes provisions requiring registration of persons whose occupation or practice is confined solely to hair braiding, hair wrapping, or body wrapping; provides that Florida Cosmetology Act does not apply to such persons; conforms provisions repeals provisions relating to Sale of Business Opportunities Act & regulation of certain business opportunities.

566.title: Captive Insurance
566.description: Revises terminology; prohibits industrial insured captive insurance company from insuring risks other than specified risks; authorizes licensure of industrial insured captive insurance companies to provide workers' compensation & employer's liability insurance in excess of specified amount; requires industrial insured captive insurance company to maintain certain amount of capital & surplus in order to continue to write excess workers' compensation; specifies certain duties or actions are responsibility of OIR; provides applicability of specified provisions to captive insurance companies & industrial insured captive insurance companies; requires pure captive insurance company to submit certain standards relating to risk management of controlled unaffiliated businesses to OIR for approval.

567.title: Taxation of Property
567.description: Deletes authorization for value adjustment board upon its own motion to review lands classified by property appraiser as agricultural or nonagricultural; deletes requirement that property appraiser must reclassify as nonagricultural certain lands that have been zoned to nonagricultural use; deletes authorization for board of county commissioners to reclassify as nonagricultural certain lands that are contiguous to urban or metropolitan development; deletes evidentiary presumption that land is not being used primarily for bona fide agricultural purposes if it is purchased for certain amount above its agricultural assessment; deletes authorization for value adjustment board upon its own motion to review property granted or denied classification by property appraiser as historic property that is being used for commercial or certain nonprofit purposes; deletes authorization for value adjustment board upon its own motion to review land granted or denied high-water recharge classification by property appraiser; deletes authorization for value adjustment board to review property tax exemptions upon its own motion or motion of property appraiser & deletes certain notice requirements relating to review of such exemptions; provides for retroactive application.

568.title: Medicaid Managed Care
568.description: Provides exemption from mandatory enrollment in managed care for children residing in certain licensed residential programs approved by DCF.

569.title: Black Cultural Tourism Enhancement Commission
569.description: Creates Black Cultural Tourism Enhancement Commission; requires DOS to provide administrative & staff support services to commission; provides powers & duties of commission; provides for appointment & terms of commission members; provides for reimbursement of per diem & travel expenses for commission members; authorizes commission to establish or designate DSO for specified purposes.

570.title: Sentencing of Offenders
570.description: Revises number of sentencing points offender might accumulate below which court must sentence offender to nonstate prison sanction.

572.last_action: Died in Health and Human Services Committee
572.title: Sovereign Immunity for Dentists and Dental Hygienists
572.description: Requires contract with governmental contractor for health care services to include provision for health care provider licensed under ch. 466, F.S., as an agent of governmental contractor, to allow patient or parent or guardian of patient to voluntarily contribute fee to cover costs of dental laboratory work related to services provided to patient without forfeiting sovereign immunity; prohibits contribution from exceeding actual amount of dental laboratory charges; provides that contribution complies with specified requirements.

573.last_action: Died in Civil Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 73 (Ch. 2013-188)
573.title: Community Associations
573.description: Revises requirements relating to preparation & completion of homeowners' association's annual financial report; revises requirements for financial report based on association's number of units; revises requirements with respect to cooperative financial statements & reports; revises requirements relating to preparation & completion of condominium association's annual financial report.

574.title: Sale of Firearms and Ammunition
574.description: Providing administrative fee to be imposed on sale of firearms & ammunition by licensed dealers; provides for deposit, distribution, & use of fee revenues; provides for annual carryforward of unexpended funds.

575.title: Trust Funds/Creation/Behavioral Health Intervention and Treatment Trust Fund/DCF
575.description: Creates Behavioral Health Intervention & Treatment TF within DCF; provides purposes of trust fund; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; provides for contingent effect.

576.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
576.title: Fireworks
576.description: Providing & revising definitions; prohibits sale or possession of consumer fireworks by persons younger than 18 years of age; provides an exception; repeals provisions relating to agricultural & fish hatchery use of fireworks.

578.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
578.title: Credit Card Solicitations on College Campuses
578.description: Prohibits solicitation of credit cards on Florida College System institution or state university campuses.

579.last_action: Died in Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations Subcommittee
579.title: Office of Faith-Based and Community Initiatives
579.description: Creates Office of Faith-Based & Community Initiatives within DEO; provides duties.

580.title: Murder of a Child 17 Years of Age or Younger
580.description: Provides for reclassification of specified murder offenses if committed upon child 17 years of age or younger; prohibits court from suspending, deferring, or withholding adjudication of guilt or imposition of sentence.

582.title: Administrative Procedures
582.description: Provides conditions under which proceeding is not substantially justified for purposes of award under Florida Equal Access to Justice Act; provides for publication of notices of rule development & of rules filed for adoption; provides additional notice of rule development, proposals, & adoptions; provides that petitioner challenging proposed rule or unadopted agency statement has burden of establishing prima facie case; provides for extension of time to render final agency action in certain circumstances; conforms proceedings opposing agency action based on invalid rule or unadopted rule to proceedings for challenging rules; requires notice of whether agency will rely on challenged rule or unadopted rule; provides for administrative law judge to make certain findings & enter final order on validity of rule or use of unadopted rule; provides for stay of proceedings not involving disputed issues of fact upon timely filing of rule challenge.

583.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
583.title: Long-Term Care Insurance Policies
583.description: Provides exemption from attachment, garnishment, or other legal process for debtor's interest in long-term care insurance policy.

584.title: Firearms
584.description: Requires 3-day waiting period for sale of any firearm; provides exceptions; prohibits sale of ammunition to person who has not completed an anger-management program; requires certification of completion of an anger-management program to be renewed every 10 years; provides minimum program requirements; prohibits purchase of ammunition by fraudulent means.

585.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
585.title: Stormwater Management System Fees
585.description: Provides that certain stormwater utility fees or per acreage fees constitute a lien on the land or premises until such fees are paid; establishes the priority of certain liens; provides for foreclosure of certain liens.

586.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
586.title: Genetically Engineered Foods
586.description: Provides definitions; provides list of commercial commodities commonly cultivated in genetically engineered form and requires DACS to publish list by specified date & to update published list annually; provides mandatory labeling requirements for genetically engineered raw agricultural commodities & processed foods made with or derived from genetically engineered ingredients; exempts specified foods, commodities, ingredients, & other substances from labeling requirements; authorizes department to adopt rules; provides for enforcement of labeling requirements; provides penalties & civil remedies.

587.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
587.title: Postsecondary General Education Courses
587.description: Requires that general education courses at lower-division level include specified number of semester hours of United States history.

588.title: Payment For Services Provided By Licensed Psychologists
588.description: Adds licensed psychologists to list of health care providers who are protected by limitations period from claims for overpayment being sought by health insurers or HMOs; adds licensed psychologists to list of health care providers who are subject to limitations period for submitting claims to health insurers or HMOs for underpayment; adds licensed psychologists to list of health care providers who are eligible for direct payment for medical services by health insurer.

589.title: Arts for All Students Act
589.description: Creates "Arts for All Students Act"; requires DOE to publish "Arts for All Students" annual report; provides components of fine arts curriculum; requires criteria & formula for granting "Arts for All Students" model school & model school district designations; provides for annual award of designations.

590.title: Appointment of Attorney for Dependent Child with Disabilities
590.description: Requires attorney for dependent child with disabilities to be appointed in writing; requires that appointment continues in effect until attorney is permitted to withdraw or is discharged by court or until case is terminated; requires that attorney be adequately compensated for his or her service; provides limitation; provides for conditional implementation.

593.title: Public Model for Hurricane Loss Projections
593.description: Requires OIR to contract with FIU to enhance capability of public model for hurricane loss projections to predict & assess certain hurricane damage; provides appropriation. APPROPRIATION:

595.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
595.title: Education Savings Account Program
595.description: Establishes Education Savings Account Program to provide student account to pay for specified educational expenses at private school, private virtual school, private tutoring program, or public or private postsecondary institution or to contribute to college savings plan or make payment for prepaid college plan.

596.title: Testing for Human Immunodeficiency Virus
596.description: Provides that informed consent to perform HIV test must be obtained from legal guardian or other person authorized by law for certain persons; revises situations in which test results may be released.

597.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
597.title: Sales of Dogs and Cats
597.description: Requires that certificate of veterinary inspection for dog or cat offered for sale within state or by seller located within state be prepared by veterinarian licensed by state of dog or cat's origin; specifies additional diseases & conditions that certificate of veterinary inspections must address; requires additional information to be included in certificate; reduces time period in which veterinary examination must take place; provides requirements for display of official certificate of veterinary inspection or other specified information; prohibits offer for sale or donation of cats & dogs at certain locations; provides exceptions.

599.last_action: Died in Government Operations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1309 (Ch. 2013-154), HB 5401 (Ch. 2013-54)
599.title: State Contracting
599.description: Requires agreements funded with state or federal financial assistance to include additional provisions; authorizes CFO to audit & approve agreements prior to execution; revises provisions relating to CFO's intergovernmental contract tracking system under Transparency Florida Act; requires state agencies to post certain information in tracking system & update that information; requires certain contract managers to be certified & directs DMS to be responsible for establishing requirements for certification; requires CFO to perform audits of executed contract documents & discuss audits with agency officials; requires agency head to respond to the audit.

601.title: State Board of Education
601.description: Requires State Board of Education to adopt rules in writing before implementing new statute or program, changing rules for existing program, or amending written technical assistance papers.

603.title: Central County Water Control District, Hendry County

604.last_action: Died in Healthy Families Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7129 (Ch. 2013-219)
604.title: Religious-Exempt Child Care Programs
604.description: Provides exemption for child care programs affiliated with religious congregations or religious boarding schools from regulation by DCF; requires display of certificate of compliance issued by accrediting agency recognized by DCF; requires accrediting agency to conduct initial onsite review; provides DCF is not authorized to regulate specified elements of program; provides timeframes within which an exempt child care program must notify an accrediting agency of its transfer & termination of accreditation; prohibits recognized accrediting agency from owning, operating, or administering certain programs.

605.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
605.title: Educator Preparation
605.description: Requires teacher preparation programs to incorporate instruction in state standards adopted by State Board of Education; provides additional means of demonstrating mastery of professional preparation & education competence; revises criteria for temporary certification; revises provisions relating to alternative certification program.

606.title: Mental Health
606.description: Revises criteria for involuntary examination; deletes requirement that less restrictive means be unavailable before law enforcement officer may take person into custody for involuntary examination; deletes prohibition on a fee for filing for involuntary examination order specifies when involuntary patient is eligible for discharge; revises discharge requirements.

608.title: East County Water Control District, Hendry & Lee Counties
608.description: Authorizes district's board of commissioners to exercise additional powers; provides for applicability.

609.title: Nassau County
609.description: Revises criteria for special alcoholic beverage licenses within Nassau County.

610.title: Tallahassee-Leon County Civic Center Authority, Leon County
610.description: Abolishes Tallahassee-Leon County Civic Center Authority; repeals provisions for authority's charter; designates Tallahassee-Leon County Civic Center as "Donald L. Tucker Civic Center"; provides for erection of suitable markers; requires DBPR's Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco to issue beverage license to FSU or its designee; transfers all assets & liabilities of authority to FSU.

611.title: Tohopekaliga Water Authority, Osceola County
611.description: Revises terms of members of authority.

612.title: Interlocal Agreements
612.description: Revises definition of term "public agency" to include public transit provider.

613.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7125 (Ch. 2013-160)
613.title: Alcohol or Drug Impairment
613.description: Provides that person commits offenses of driving or boating while impaired if driver satisfies specified criteria relating to consumption of alcohol or controlled substances; provides that person commits offense of driving while impaired if person has in blood or urine certain controlled substances in specified circumstances; provides that person is entitled to affirmative defense to offense of driving while impaired if, under certain circumstances, person charged with offense introduced controlled substance into his or her body pursuant to prescription; provides that use of nonprescribed substance does not constitute affirmative defense; provides that legal use alcohol, controlled substances, etc. does not constitute defense against charge of driving while impaired; provides that person commits offense of use of firearm while impaired if person uses firearm & satisfies specified criteria relating to consumption of alcohol or controlled substances; revises amount of alcohol concentration that gives rise to presumption of impairment for purposes of offense; conforms provisions.

616.title: Transportation
616.description: Revises provisions for outdoor signs along state roads.

618.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
618.title: Mortgage Principal Reduction Program
618.description: Creates "Mortgage Principal Reduction Act"; requires that Florida Housing Finance Corporation apply to United States Department of Treasury to request funds from federal Hardest-Hit Fund program to establish new state program to reduce principal on mortgages for persons whose homestead property in this state is in foreclosure; requires corporation to use allocated funds to purchase delinquent mortgages from lenders at discount to reduce mortgage principal amount due on mortgage; creates application process & corporate procedures; specifies that only members of The Florida Bar & HUD-certified counselors working for nonprofit entity may assist program applicants in applying for or program participants in servicing loan created by program; requires that corporation submit monthly reports to Office of Governor, President of Senate, & Speaker of House of Representatives.

619.title: Punitive Damages
619.description: Specifies that statutory limits on punitive damages do not create presumption as to appropriate level of damages.

620.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
620.title: Financing of Motor Vehicles
620.description: Revises definitions & defines term "financed product"; prohibits manufacturer or wholesale distributor that offers certain financed product from taking certain actions relating to paper arising from retail sale or lease of motor vehicle which includes third party's financed product.

621.title: Governmental Accountability
621.description: Provides that each public agency contract for services must meet specified requirements; requires agreements funded with state or federal financial assistance to include additional provisions; requires CFO to perform audits of executed agreements & discuss such audits with agency officials; authorizes DMS to lead or enter into joint agreements with governmental entities for purchase of commodities or contractual services that can be used by multiple agencies; provides that contracts awarded pursuant to invitation to bid shall be awarded to responsible & responsive vendor that submits lowest responsive bid; revises exceptions to requirement that purchase of specified commodities or contractual services be made only as result of receiving competitive sealed bids, competitive sealed proposals, or competitive sealed replies; authorizes agency to negotiate better pricing upon renewal of contract; provides contract manager certification for contract managers responsible for contracts in excess of specified threshold amount; requires DMS, in consultation with CFO to maintain program for online procurement of commodities & contractual services; requires CFO to perform audits of executed contract documents & to discuss such audits with agency officials; provides that Project Management Professionals training for personnel involved in managing outsourcings & negotiations is subject to annual appropriations, etc.

622.last_action: Died in Government Operations Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1309 (Ch. 2013-154)
622.title: Pub. Rec./DSO/Office of Supplier Diversity/DMS
622.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for identity of donor or prospective donor to direct-support organization authorized to assist Office of Supplier Diversity within DMS, & all information identifying such donor or prospective donor; provides conditions for exemption; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides for contingent effect.

624.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1036 (Ch. 2013-178)
624.title: Independent Living
624.description: Revises provisions for jurisdiction of a child found to be dependent; provides that court retains jurisdiction until child reaches a certain age; provides for transition plan after child reaches specified age; provides requirements for extended foster care; provides duties of department, community-based care lead agency, & case manager; provides for court jurisdiction, reviews, & review hearings; provides for appointment of a guardian ad litem; requires information sharing; provides for adoption; specifies foster parent room & board rates; authorizes community-based care service providers to pay for certain services; provides for Road-to-Independence Program for young adults; & creates Independent Living Services Advisory Council.

625.title: Marketable Record Title
625.description: Provides that marketable record title may not extinguish certain restrictions or covenants that are accepted by governmental entity or any right, title, or interest that is held in trust for public; provides that ch. 712, F.S., does not affect any right, title, or interest of political subdivision in this state.

627.title: Florida Keys Aqueduct Authority, Monroe County
627.description: Revising membership of board of directors of Florida Keys Aqueduct Authority; provides that members be elected in nonpartisan elections rather than appointed.

629.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-98, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1327 (Ch. 2013-99)
629.title: Victims of Human Trafficking
629.description: Revises mental, emotional, or developmental age of child victim whose out-of-court statement describing specified criminal acts is admissible in evidence in certain instances; provides for expungement of criminal history record of victim of human trafficking; designates what offenses may be expunged; provides that conviction expunged under this act is deemed to have been vacated due to substantive defect in underlying criminal proceedings; provides for period in which such expungement must be sought; provides that official documentation of victim's status as human trafficking victim creates presumption; provides standard of proof absent such documentation; provides requirements for petitions; provides for parties & service; provides for electronic appearances of petitioners & attorneys; provides for orders of relief; provides for physical destruction of records; authorizes person whose records are expunged to lawfully deny or fail to acknowledge arrests covered by expunged record; provides exceptions; provides that such lawful denial is not perjury or subject person to liability. APPROPRIATION:

630.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-99, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1325 (Ch. 2013-98)
630.title: Pub. Rec./Crim. Hist./Human Trafficking Victims
630.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for criminal history records of victims of human trafficking expunged under s. 943.0583, F.S.; provides exception; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption under Open Government Sunset Review Act.

632.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
632.title: Broward County/Council for Services for Seniors
632.description: Creates Broward County Council for Services for Seniors; provides for ad valorem assessments; provides powers & duties; requires referendum.

633.title: Public Records/Toll Facilities
633.description: Provides public records exemption for personal identifying information held by DOT, county, or expressway authority for purpose of paying, prepaying, or collecting tolls & associated administrative charges for use of toll facilities.

634.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
634.title: Traffic Offenses
634.description: Provides criminal penalties for a person who commits a moving violation that causes serious bodily injury to, or causes or contributes to the death of, a pedestrian or a person operating or riding in a motor vehicle or operating or riding on a motorcycle or bicycle.

635.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
635.title: Supplier Diversity
635.description: Authorizes PSC to require certain regulated corporations to submit plans for increasing procurement from businesses controlled & operated by women, minorities, & disabled veterans; provides guidelines & criteria for procurement programs; provides penalties for certain violations.

638.title: Weapons or Firearms
638.description: Creates "Universal Background Check Act"; requires transfers of firearms when neither party is licensed dealer to be conducted through licensed dealer; requires deposit of firearm with dealer; requires processing by dealer; provides for disposition of firearm if dealer cannot legally complete transaction; authorizes fee; provides exceptions; requires reports of violations.

639.title: State Judicial System
639.description: Construes application of common & statute laws of England to state; expands list of recipients required to be provided specified annual report of Florida Supreme Court; specifies required use of such report; requires Supreme Court to develop plan for civics promotion & judicial branch education purposes; requires annual plan implementation report; specifies report recipients & uses; requires Supreme Court to submit to specified recipients all final reports completed by specified committees; specifies uses of such reports; requires Auditor General & OPPAGA to conduct biennial full audit reviews & examinations of state courts system; requires reports; specifies report recipients; specifies additional jurisdiction of circuit courts; establishes specified divisions within each judicial circuit for specified purposes; provides for administration of divisions; increases membership of Judicial Qualifications Commission; revises commission expenses authorization; requires commission to hire staff for each commission panel; provides requirements for staff committees for commission panels; requires reports of staff committees; specifies report recipients; specifies such reports as public records; requires Auditor General & OPPAGA to conduct biennial full audit reviews & examinations of commission.

640.title: Trust Funds/Fiscal Stability TF/State Courts System
640.description: Creates Fiscal Stability TF within state courts system to be administered by Supreme Court; provides for fund revenues; provides for administration of trust fund & use of moneys in fund; requires balances to remain in trust fund at end of fiscal year; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

641.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7013 (Ch. 2013-57)
641.title: Presidential Preference Primaries
641.description: Renames Presidential Preference Primary Date Selection Committee as Presidential Candidate Selection Committee; revises membership of committee; revises & establishes date of presidential preference primary; providing duties of committee, Department of State, & Secretary of State; revises certain submission deadlines & meeting dates; provides rulemaking authority; provides qualifying date for delegates.

642.title: Care of Children in Nursing Home Facilities
642.description: Requires AHCA, in collaboration with DOH's Division of Children's Medical Services, to adopt rules for care of children in Children's Special Care Centers; provides licensure requirements for such facilities; provides requirements relating to child's individualized care plan.

644.title: Purchase of Firearms by Mentally Ill Persons
644.description: Provides conditions under which person who has been voluntarily admitted to mental institution for treatment & has undergone involuntary examination under Baker Act may be prohibited from purchasing firearm; provides requirements for examining physician; provides for judicial review of certain findings; provides specified notice requirements; provides form & contents of notice; provides requirements with respect to filing of specified records with court & presentation of such records to judge or magistrate; provides lawful authority of judge or magistrate to review specified records & order that such records be submitted to FDLE; provides a timeframe for submission of records to FDLE upon order of record by judge or magistrate.

645.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 1594 (Ch. 2013-135)
645.title: Guaranteed Energy, Water, & Wastewater Performance Savings Contracting Act
645.description: Revises definitions; provides that contract may provide for repayments to lender of installation construction loan in installments for period not to exceed 20 years; requires contract to provide that repayments to lender of installation construction loan may be made over time, not to exceed 20 years from certain date; requires contract to provide for certain amount of repayment to lender of installation construction loan within 2 years after specified date; authorizes certain facility alterations to be included in performance contract & to be supervised by performance savings contractor; limits time allotted to Office of CFO to review & approve agency's guaranteed energy, water, & wastewater performance savings contract; requires that proposed contract include investment-grade audit certified by DMS.

646.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
646.title: Reedy Creek Improvement District, Orange & Osceola Counties
646.description: Provides exception to general law; provides for resolution of impasse between Reedy Creek Improvement District & employee organization.

647.title: Tampa Port Authority, Hillsborough County
647.description: Deletes requirement that certain expenditures be approved by affirmative vote of specified number of members of the authority.

648.last_action: Died in Insurance and Banking Subcommittee
648.title: Stop-Payment Orders
648.description: Provides that stop-payment order remains in effect permanently unless bank receives written notification of cancellation of such order & payment of applicable fee; prohibits bank from charging more than single fee for stop-payment order to remain in effect permanently; revises provisions relating to notices given to banks of postdating of checks, to conform.

649.title: District School Tax
649.description: Authorizes school district to levy by super majority vote of district school board additional millage for school operational purposes for 2013-2014 fiscal year.

650.title: Immigrant Entrepreneur & STEM Student Recruitment & Retention Act
650.description: Provides for issuance of temporary driver license to specified immigrant entrepreneurs & certain foreign students in specified fields within science, technology, engineering, & mathematics (STEM); provides eligibility requirements for issuance of temporary driver licenses to immigrant entrepreneurs & STEM students.

651.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
651.title: Beef Labeling
651.description: Requires beef containing certain beef trimmings to be labeled in specified way.

652.title: Service of Process
652.description: Requires sheriffs to charge uniform fee for service of process; requires employer to allow authorized individual to make service on employee in private area designated by employer; provides civil fine for employers failing to comply with process; revises provisions relating to substitute service if specified number of attempts of service made at business that is sole proprietorship; requires person requesting service or person authorized to serve process to file return-of-service form; revises provisions relating to service on corporation; provides that sheriff may rely on affidavit submitted by levying creditor; provides that sheriff may apply for instructions from court regarding distribution of proceeds from levy sale.

653.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
653.title: Value Adjustment Boards
