653.description: Revises membership of VABs; provides for appointment & qualifications of professional member & alternate professional member of VAB; provides for election of chairperson & alternate chairperson & requirements with respect thereto; revises requirements relating to composition of quorum of board members; provides duties for board & clerk of board; provides oversight responsibilities for board with respect to activities of specified individuals; provides conditions, requirements, & limitations relating to selection, appointment, & service of board attorney; provides duties, responsibilities, & requirements for board attorney; provides requirements with respect to verbal or written advice given by board attorney; provides requirements relating to written contract between board & board attorney; provides for maintenance of records relating to board & board attorney; provides legislative intent; provides requirements for written decisions of board & special magistrates; provides requirements for board, special magistrates, & DOR with respect to administrative reviews involving just value assessments of real property; provides requirements for board & special magistrates relating to submission & consideration of recommended decisions. APPROPRIATION:

654.title: Patient Lifting and Handling Practices
654.description: Requires hospitals to establish policy concerning safe lifting & handling of patients; requires committee to develop & evaluate policy.

655.title: Presuit Discovery in Medical Negligence Actions
655.description: Revises authorization form for release of protected health information to clarify that authorization only permits health care providers to furnish copies of written & electronic medical records & clarifies provisions relating to use of patient's health information.

656.title: Children Who Are Deaf Or Hard Of Hearing
656.description: Requires health care providers to provide opportunity for child's parent or legal guardian to provide contact information so that he or she may receive information from specified service providers when hearing loss is identified; requires DOH to register certain service providers & institutions; allows parent or legal guardian to request services from participating service provider; provides that level of services received is based on child's individualized education program or individual & family service plan; provides for eligibility; provides funding formula; requires department to develop standards for participating service providers; authorizes department to adopt rules.

657.title: Agricultural Storage and Shipping Containers
657.description: Authorizes use of certain brands & marks on containers used for storage & transport of agricultural & other commercial products to designate & distinguish ownership of containers; provides requirements for sale & purchase of specified number of plastic bulk merchandise containers; provides that prosecuting attorneys may inspect records of purchase at any time upon reasonable notice; provides criminal & civil penalties; provides exception for operator of waste management facility & certain tax-exempt entities.

658.title: Discretionary School Sales Surtax
658.description: Revises provisions with respect to content of school board resolutions that impose discretionary school surtaxes & required referendum ballot statements relating to such resolutions; provides that inclusion of specified costs for technology in plan for use of surtax proceeds is discretionary; authorizes expenditure of surtax proceeds for certain fixed capital expenditures & costs associated with facilities & campuses of Florida College System institutions & state universities under specified conditions & circumstances.

660.title: Firefighter and Police Officer Pension Plans
660.description: Requires additional mandatory payments by municipalities & special fire control districts to pension trust funds & defined benefit plans; requires plan sponsors to have defined contribution plans in place by a certain date; deletes provisions limiting amount of overtime payments for calculating retirement benefits; revises provisions for distribution & use of certain tax funds by municipalities & special fire control districts.

661.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
661.title: Reigniting Education Achievement with Coordinated Help Pilot Program
661.description: Requires DOE to implement pilot program as public-private partnership in low-performing public schools; specifies services to be offered with goal of improving student academic achievement; provides requirements for implementation of program.

662.title: Key Largo Wastewater Treatment District, Monroe County
662.description: Revises district's governing board vacancies & compensation, subject to annual adjustment according to specified price index.

663.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
663.title: State Uniform Traffic Control
663.description: Prohibits traffic infraction enforcement officer from issuing notice of violation & traffic citation for failure to stop at red light.

664.title: Trust Funds/Charter School Educational Facility TF/Department of Education
664.description: Creates Charter School Educational Facility TF within DOE; provides for source of funds & purpose; provides for annual carryforward of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

665.title: Pinellas County
665.description: Updates terminology applicable to provisions relating to Pinellas Police Standards Council; revises certain assessments of court costs that provide funding for council.

667.title: Madison County
667.description: Provides for special alcoholic beverage license to be issued to certain hotels & motels.

668.title: Florida Renewable Fuel Standard Act
668.description: Repeals Florida Renewable Fuel Standard Act.

669.last_action: Died in Energy and Utilities Subcommittee
669.title: Nuclear and Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle Power Plants
669.description: Repeals provisions for cost recovery mechanisms for siting, design, licensing, & construction of nuclear & integrated gasification combined cycle power plants, including mechanisms that promote utility investment in, & allow for recovery in electric utility rates of certain costs of, such plants.

670.last_action: Unfavorable by Criminal Justice Subcommittee, laid on Table; YEAS 4 NAYS 9, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7083 (Ch. 2013-216)
670.title: Death Penalty
670.description: Deletes provisions providing for death penalty for capital felonies; deletes provisions relating to representation in death penalty cases; repeals provisions relating to capital collateral representation, jurors in capital cases, prohibiting imposition of death sentence on defendant with mental retardation, determination of whether to impose sentence of death or life imprisonment for capital felony or capital drug trafficking felony, issuance of warrant of execution, stay of execution of death sentence, proceedings when person under sentence of death appears to be insane, proceedings when person under sentence of death appears to be pregnant, grounds for death warrant, execution of death sentence, prohibition against reduction of death sentence as result of determination that method of execution is unconstitutional, sentencing orders in capital cases, regulation of execution, transfer to state prison for safekeeping before death warrant issued, return of warrant of execution issued by Governor, sentence of death unexecuted for unjustifiable reasons, & return of warrant of execution issued by Supreme Court.

671.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 326 (Ch. 2013-231)
671.title: Powers and Duties of Department of Environmental Protection
671.description: Removes an obsolete reference for purposes of calculating the reimbursement for transportation & utility crossings of greenways lands in Marion County; repeals provisions relating to additional powers & duties of the department to dispose of surplus lands that were for the construction, operation, or promotion of a canal across the peninsula of the state & refund payments to counties.

672.title: Use of Deadly Force in Defense of a Person
672.description: Repeals provisions relating to home protection & use of deadly force, which created presumption of fear of death or great bodily harm in certain circumstances & provided that there is no duty to retreat & has the right to stand one's ground & meet force with force in certain circumstances; conforms provisions.

674.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-96, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 406 (Ch. 2013-42)
674.title: Tax Refund Programs
674.description: Deletes caps on tax refunds for qualified defense contractors & space flight businesses & for qualified target industry businesses.

675.last_action: Died in Transportation and Highway Safety Subcommittee
675.title: Motorcycle Equipment
675.description: Removes provision that limits height of motorcycle handlebars or handgrips.

676.title: Privacy of Firearm Owners
676.description: Repeals provisions relating to medical privacy concerning firearms & prohibited acts by health care practitioners, health care facilities, & insurers related to collection & use of certain information concerning patient's ownership of firearms; conforms provisions.

678.title: County Delinquency Programs and Facilities
678.description: Deletes provisions allowing county to comply with juvenile detention requirements by providing for preadjudication detention in facilities of county sheriff, another county jail operator, or contracted provider in certain circumstances.

679.title: Kidcare
679.description: Repeals provision denying eligibility for Title XXI-funded premium assistance for health benefits coverage under Kidcare to child who is an alien.

680.last_action: Died in Higher Education and Workforce Subcommittee
680.title: Student Fee Exemptions
680.description: Deletes exemption from payment of tuition & fees at school districts that provide workforce education programs & public postsecondary educational institutions for certain students who lack regular nighttime residence or sleeping accommodation.

681.last_action: Died in Agriculture and Natural Resources Subcommittee
681.title: Florida Forest Service
681.description: Deletes authority of Florida Forest Service to operate seedling tree nursery program & sell seedling trees to public for purposes of federal Clarke-McNary Law.

682.last_action: Died in Governmental Oversight and Accountability
682.title: Governor's Private Secretary
682.description: Repeals authority of Governor to appoint & commission private secretary.

683.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1094 (Ch. 2013-133)
683.title: Home Health Agencies
683.description: Deletes requirements for quarterly reporting by home health agency of certain data submitted to AHCA.

684.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1013 (Ch. 2013-259), SB 954 (Ch. 2013-235)
684.title: Technological Research & Development Authority
684.description: Removes provisions for distribution of certain funds to TRDA.

685.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
685.title: Developments of Regional Impact
685.description: Deletes provisions authorizing the state land planning agency, regional planning agencies, or local governments to petition the Administration Commission to increase or decrease numerical thresholds of statewide guidelines & standards used in determining whether developments are subject to development-of-regional-impact review.

686.title: Broward County/Saltwater Fishing
686.description: Repeals act relating to saltwater fishing.

689.title: Florida Building Code
689.description: Repeals provisions relating to development & maintenance of biennial coastal building zone construction training program.

691.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
691.title: Public School Parental Choice
691.description: Deletes requirement for annual reporting on status of school choice.

692.title: Statewide School Safety Hotline
692.description: Repeals provisions relating to statewide toll-free school safety hotline.

693.last_action: Died in Choice and Innovation Subcommittee
693.title: Service Learning
693.description: Repeals provisions relating to school district service-learning programs, activities, & policies.

694.title: City of Pensacola, Escambia County
694.description: Repeals Civil Service System for city employees.

695.last_action: Died in Economic Development and Tourism Subcommittee
695.title: Sales and Use Tax on Services
695.description: Deletes provisions relating to imposition & application of sales & use tax to detective, burglar protection, & other protection services, nonresidential cleaning services, & nonresidential building pest control services.

696.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7083 (Ch. 2013-216)
696.title: Criminal Proceedings
696.description: Repeals provisions relating to capital postconviction proceedings, order in which closing arguments are given, grounds for death warrant, sentencing orders in capital cases; postconviction review in capital cases; repeals provisions relating to commencement of capital postconviction actions, capital postconviction claims, & sanctions in postconviction proceedings; deletes provisions relating to legislative intent concerning adoption of rules concerning acceptance of guilty pleas & effect of certain postponements for speedy trial purposes; deletes provisions relating to development of uniform order of supervision form, providing for imposition of sanction following revocation of probation or parole, allowing for offenders under supervision to be charged for urinalysis testing in certain circumstances, & providing for payment plans & establishment of priority orders for payments.

697.title: General Appropriations Act
697.description: Provides moneys for annual period beginning July 1, 2013, & ending June 30, 2014, & supplemental appropriations for period ending June 30, 2013, to pay salaries & other expenses, capital outlay-buildings & other improvements, & for other specified purposes of various agencies of state government. APPROPRIATION:

698.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7065 (Ch. 2013-59), SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40), SB 1502 (Ch. 2013-41), SB 1802 (Ch. 2013-52)
698.title: Implementing 2013-2014 General Appropriations Act
698.description: Implements 2013-2014 GAA; incorporates by reference calculations of FEFP; provides that funds for instructional materials shall be released and expended as required in proviso language; incorporates by reference certain calculations for Accelerated Connectivity Highway; provides requirements to govern Onsite Sewage Nitrogen Reduction Strategies Study; incorporates by reference certain calculations of the Medicaid Low-Income Pool, Disproportionate Share Hospital, & Hospital Reimbursement Programs; authorizes DOC to submit budget amendment for additional positions; requires DJJ to comply with specified reimbursement limitations; directs DMS to use tenant brokers; authorizes DACS to renew certain contracts; provides for distribution of Florida Forever Trust Fund; requires certain competitive bidding; authorizes EOG transfers; provides for issuance of new debt; limits travel funds; provides co-payment amounts for state employees prescription drug program.

700.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40), SB 1504 (Ch. 2013-43)
700.title: Collective Bargaining
700.description: Provides for resolution of collective bargaining issues at impasse between State of Florida & certified bargaining units for state employees pursuant to specified instructions.

701.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40), SB 1502 (Ch. 2013-41)
701.title: Information Technology Governance
701.description: Transfers Agency for Enterprise Information Technology, Northwood Shared Resource Center & Southwood Shared Resource Center to Agency for State Technology; provides duties & responsibilities of the agency, data centers, & state agencies.

702.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40)
702.title: Trust Funds/State Technology Working Capital Trust Fund
702.description: Creates State Technology Working Capital Trust Fund within Agency for State Technology of EOG; provides for purpose of trust fund & sources of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; provides for contingent effect.

703.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40), SB 1802 (Ch. 2013-52)
703.title: Health Benefits for OPS Employees
703.description: Revises & provides definitions; provides that state group insurance program may develop separate benefit plan for full-time OPS employees; provides that full-time OPS employees may participate in state group insurance program; authorizes DMS to adopt rules for certain purposes; requires department to contract for health benefit plan for full-time OPS employees; provides contract requirements; authorizes full-time OPS employees to participate in state group insurance program.

705.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40), SB 1520 (Ch. 2013-48)
705.title: Medicaid
705.description: Repeals provisions relating to Community Hospital Education Act; modifies timeframe for designation of rural hospitals; provides methodology for establishing hospital inpatient & outpatient base reimbursement rates; deletes requirement to develop plan to convert Medicaid inpatient hospital rates to diagnosis-related groups; specifies dates by which local governmental entities must submit letters of agreement for intergovernmental transfers & dates by which AHCA may correct errors in rate calculations for inpatient & outpatient rates; continues Medicaid disproportionate share program distributions for nonstate government-owned or operated hospitals eligible for payment on July 1, 2011; establishes Statewide Medicaid Graduate Medical Education program; revises Medicaid disproportionate share program distribution criteria for specialty hospitals related to tuberculosis patient services.

706.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40), SB 1518 (Ch. 2013-47)
706.title: Community-based Care
706.description: Revises allocations of recurring core services funding for community-based care lead agencies.

708.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-54, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40)
708.title: Transparency in Government Spending
708.description: Requires EOG to establish single website providing access to other websites; requires office to establish website providing information about fiscal planning for state & specifies information to be included on website; requires DMS to maintain website that provides current information on state employees & officers; requires CFO to establish & maintain secure contract tracking system; requires that exempt & confidential information be redacted from contracts & procurement documents posted on system; authorizes CFO to regulate & prohibit posting of certain information that could facilitate identity theft or cause harm; creates User Experience Task Force to develop & recommend design for consolidating existing state-managed websites, etc.

709.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-55, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7023 (Ch. 2013-251), SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40)
709.title: Weights and Measures Instruments and Devices
709.description: Creates & repeals provisions relating to commercial use permits for weights & measures instruments & devices to provide for codification in Florida Statutes of expiration of specified provisions & extension of expiration date.

712.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1096 (Ch. 2013-35), CS/CS/SB 1076 (Ch. 2013-27), SB 1514 (Ch. 2013-45), CS/CS/SB 1664 (Ch. 2013-185)
712.title: Repeal of Education Provisions
712.description: Repeals various provisions of law & removes duplicative, redundant, or unused rulemaking authority relating to education.

713.title: Interstate Compact on Educational Opportunity for Military Children
713.description: Abrogates future repeal of compact; provides for future legislative review & repeal of compact; provides for payment of annual dues for compact.

714.title: Massage Establishments
714.description: Revises definition of term "board-approved massage school"; provides additional grounds for denial of license or disciplinary action; revises penalties; prohibits operation of massage establishment during specified times; provides exceptions; prohibits use of massage establishment as principal domicile unless establishment is zoned for residential use under local ordinance; provides penalties; declares that massage establishment operating in violation of specified statutes is nuisance that may be abated or enjoined.

716.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-250, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1076 (Ch. 2013-27)
716.title: Education
716.description: Revises various provisions relating to charter schools; requires that full implementation of online assessments for Next Generation Sunshine State Standards in English/language arts & mathematics for all K-12 public school students occur only after technology infrastructure, connectivity, & capacity of all public schools & school districts have been load tested & independently verified as ready for successful deployment & implementation; provides that student may not be assigned to unsatisfactory teacher, particularly in single subject if student is in high school or middle school, for two consecutive school years; provides calculation for compliance with class size maximums for public school of choice; limits number of schools of technology that may be operated & established in school district; provides for Region of Technology in which three or more school districts enter into joint performance contract; requires State Board of Education to monitor schools of technology for compliance with act & performance contracts.

719.title: Expert Testimony
719.description: Provides that witness qualified as expert by knowledge, skill, experience, training, or education may testify in form of opinion as to facts at issue in case; requires courts to interpret & apply principles of expert testimony in conformity with specified U.S. Supreme Court decisions; subjects pure opinion testimony to such requirements; provides that facts or data that are otherwise inadmissible may not be disclosed to jury by proponent of opinion or inference unless court determines that probative value of facts or data in assisting jury to evaluate expert's opinion substantially outweighs prejudicial effect.

720.title: Terms of Courts
720.description: Repeals provisions relating to regular terms of Supreme Court & circuit courts; repeals provisions relating to requiring judge to attend first day of each term of circuit court; repeals provisions relating to requirement for judge to state reason for nonattendance, penalty for nonattendance of judge, adjournment of circuit court upon nonattendance of judge, calling all cases on docket at end of each term, regular terms of district courts of appeal, special terms of district courts of appeal, requirement that criminal trials be heard in term of court prior to civil cases, & requirement that persons in custody be arraigned & tried in term of court unless good cause is shown; conforms provisions; allows Supreme Court to set terms of court for Supreme Court, district courts of appeal, & circuit courts; provides that appellate courts may withdraw mandate within 120 days after its issuance.

721.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-213, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 269 (Ch. 2013-193), CS/CS/CS/HB 375 (Ch. 2013-79), CS/CS/HB 537 (Ch. 2013-115)
721.title: Development Permits
721.description: Requires counties & municipalities to attach certain disclaimers & include certain permit conditions when issuing development permits; provides that initiative or referendum process for any local comprehensive plan amendments & map amendments is prohibited; prohibits owners of communication facilities from offering certain services to persons unrelated to high-speed rail system; provides for permit authorizing permittee to locate, construct, operate, & maintain communication facilities within new or existing high speed rail system; provides that county may include commercial development that is ancillary to professional sports facility in lease of sports facility, etc.

722.last_action: Died in Ethics and Elections Subcommittee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7013 (Ch. 2013-57)
722.title: Late Voter Registration
722.description: Revises persons authorized to register late to vote.

723.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-251, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5501 (Ch. 2013-55)
723.title: Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
723.description: Transfers collection of motor fuel inspection fee from DOACS to DOR; revises firearms recertification training requirements for specified licenses of private security, private investigative, & repossession industries; revises information required to be displayed on specified solicitation materials; revises requirements & procedure for renewal of liquefied petroleum gas licenses; revises requirements of mandatory written disclosure statement provided to purchasers of business opportunities; requires specified persons who sell timeshare plans to be licensed as commercial telephone sellers or salespersons under ch. 501, F.S.

724.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-159, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 73 (Ch. 2013-188)
724.title: Timeshares
724.description: Specifies that certain provisions relating to condominium board elections do not apply to timeshare condominiums; revises formula requirements for calculating reserves for accommodations & facilities of real property timeshare plans; requires successor in interest to be listed as owner of timeshare interest under certain conditions; requires estoppel letter in certain timeshare resale transfer transactions; prohibits certain activities related to offering timeshare interest transfer services; requires resale transfer agreements to contain specified information; requires establishment of escrow account for certain purposes; provides requirements & duties of escrow agent; providing penalties; revises procedure for trustee foreclosure of assessment & mortgage liens; revises conditions under which trustee may sell foreclosed encumbered timeshare interest; revises & provides notice requirements; provides for perfection of notice; provides requirements for notice of lis pendens; provides exceptions for actions for failure to follow trustee foreclosure procedure.

725.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1720 (Ch. 2013-51)
725.title: Education Accountability
725.description: Revises provisions relating to K-20 education performance accountability system; revises provisions relating to collecting & reporting statewide education data; requires improved access to data maintained by K-20 data warehouse; requires school districts to allocate funds for interventions to improve performance of Title I schools; revises provisions relating to schools assigned school grade or school improvement rating.

727.last_action: Died in Criminal Justice, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 585 (Ch. 2013-116), CS/CS/HB 1325 (Ch. 2013-98)
727.title: Sex Offenses
727.description: Provides that out-of-court statement by child victim with physical, mental, emotional, or developmental age of 16 or less rather than 11 or less describing specified criminal acts is admissible in evidence in certain instances; replaces definition of "instant message name" with "Internet identifier"; provides that voluntary disclosure of specified information waives disclosure exemption for such information; requires disclosure of additional information by registrants; adds additional offenses to list of sexual predator qualifying offenses; provides enhanced penalties for third or subsequent indecent exposure violations; requires court to hold defendant subject to registration as sexual offender or sexual predator without bail until first appearance; provides exception; revises eligibility for removal of requirement to register as sexual offender or sexual predator; revises definition of "risk assessment"; authorizes court to require sexual offenders & sexual predators on probation or community control to undergo evaluation to determine whether offender or predator needs sexual offender treatment.

728.title: Judiciary
728.description: Revises requirements for appointment of members of judicial nominating commissions; provides that, with exception of members selected from list of nominees provided by Board of Governors of The Florida Bar, current member of judicial nominating commission (JNC) appointed by Governor serves at pleasure of Governor; provides for each expired term or vacancy to be filled by appointment in same manner as member whose position is being filled; deletes obsolete provisions; deletes requirement that Executive Office of Governor establish uniform rules of procedure consistent with State Constitution when suspending for cause member of JNC; provides that JNC for 1st DCA will nominate persons to Office of Judges of Compensation Claims; deletes provisions creating nominating commission solely for Office of Judges of Compensation Claims.

729.title: Pretrial Detention
729.description: Requires court considering whether to release defendant on bail to determine whether defendant is subject to registration as sexual offender or sexual predator &, if so, to hold defendant without bail until first appearance on case; provides additional factors court may consider when ordering pretrial detention.

730.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 204 (Ch. 2013-5)
730.title: Trust Fund Terminations/DOT
730.description: Terminates the Everglades Parkway Construction Trust Fund, the Jacksonville Transportation Authority Project Construction Trust Fund, and the Federal Law Enforcement Trust Fund within DOT; provides for transfer of balances or revenues in the trust funds; requires DOT to pay outstanding debts or obligations of the trust funds; requires CFO to close out and remove the terminated funds from the state accounting systems.

731.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 200 (Ch. 2013-3)
731.title: Transportation Revenue Bond Trust Fund/DOT
731.description: Re-creates Transportation Revenue Bond Trust Fund within DOT without modification; repeals provisions relating to termination of the trust fund, to conform.

732.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 202 (Ch. 2013-4)
732.title: Transportation Governmental Bond Trust Fund/DOT
732.description: Re-creates Transportation Governmental Bond Trust Fund within DOT without modification; repeals provisions relating to termination of the trust fund, to conform.

733.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 206 (Ch. 2013-6)
733.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/DOS
733.description: Re-creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DOS without modification; repeals provisions relating to the termination of trust fund, to conform.

734.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 210 (Ch. 2013-8)
734.title: Trust Funds/Clearing Funds Trust Fund/DOS
734.description: Re-creates Clearing Funds Trust Fund within DOS without modification; repeals provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

735.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 208 (Ch. 2013-7)
735.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/DEO
735.description: Re-creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DEO modification; repeals provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

736.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 214 (Ch. 2013-9)
736.title: Trust Funds/Termination/Florida Forever Program Trust Fund/DEP
736.description: Terminates Florida Forever Program TF within DEP; provides for disposition of balances in & revenues of trust fund; prescribes procedures for termination of trust fund; repeals provisions relating to Florida Forever Program TF within DEP; revises designation of revenues from disposal of lands in Preservation 2000 program.

738.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 212 (Ch. 2013-22)
738.title: Trust Funds/FWCC
738.description: Removes obsolete provisions relating to authority of FWCC to transfer specified cash balances into Federal Grants Trust Fund to support cash flow needs; deletes restriction on expenditure from Lifetime Fish & Wildlife Trust Fund; renames Fish & Wildlife Habitat Program as Land Acquisition Trust Fund; provides for administration & funding of Save the Manatee Trust Fund; provides for administration & funding of Invasive Plant Control Trust Fund.

739.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 220 (Ch. 2013-12)
739.title: Capital Collateral Regional Counsel TF/Justice Administrative Commission
739.description: Re-creates Capital Collateral Regional Counsel TF within Justice Administrative Commission without modification; repeals provisions that abrogate provisions relating to scheduled termination of TF, to conform.

740.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1076 (Ch. 2013-27), CS/CS/SB 1720 (Ch. 2013-51)
740.title: Postsecondary Education
740.description: Establishes Office of K-20 Articulation in DOE; creates preeminent state research universities program; establishes academic & research standards for university to be designated preeminent state research university; provides for preeminent state research university to establish institute for online learning; provides for BOG oversight enforcement authority; revises provisions relating to adult education programs, career education programs, college readiness, & tuition, fees, & funding; provides for performance funding for postsecondary institutions based on accountability.

741.title: Driver Licensing
741.description: Revises provisions for exemption from obtaining driver license issued by this state; removes requirement that certain nonresidents possess International Driving Permit; provides that nonresident of certain age possessing valid noncommercial driver license issued outside this state may operate noncommercial motor vehicle in this state; provides for retroactive application.

742.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 216 (Ch. 2013-10)
742.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/DMS
742.description: Re-creating the Federal Grants Trust Fund within DMS without modification; repeals provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

743.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 218 (Ch. 2013-11)
743.title: Mortgage Guaranty Trust Fund/DFS/OFR
743.description: Re-creates the Mortgage Guaranty Trust Fund within Office of Financial Regulation of DFS without modification; repeals provisions relating to termination of trust fund, to conform.

744.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-59, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1502 (Ch. 2013-41)
744.title: Everglades Improvement and Management
744.description: Revises legislative findings for achieving water quality goals; revises definition of term "Long-Term Plan"; revises provisions for use of certain ad valorem tax proceeds; directs SFWMD to complete specified analysis; revises provisions for collection of agricultural privilege tax; provides for use of such tax proceeds; provides that payment of such tax & certain costs fulfills certain constitutional obligations; provides appropriations. APPROPRIATION:

745.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 686 (Ch. 2013-13)
745.title: Official Florida Statutes
745.description: Adopts Florida Statutes 2013 & designates portions thereof that are to constitute official law of state; provides that Florida Statutes 2013 shall be effective immediately upon publication; provides that general laws enacted during 2012 special session "B" & prior thereto & not included in Florida Statutes 2013 are repealed; provides that general laws enacted during 2013 regular session are not repealed by this adoption act.

746.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 690 (Ch. 2013-15)
746.title: Florida Statutes
746.description: Deletes provisions that have expired, have become obsolete, have had their effect, have served their purpose, or have been impliedly repealed or superseded; replaces incorrect cross-references & citations; corrects grammatical, typographical, & like errors; removes inconsistencies, redundancies, & unnecessary repetition in statutes; improves clarity of statutes & facilitates their correct interpretation; confirms restoration of provisions unintentionally omitted from republication in acts of Legislature during amendatory process & removes gender-specific references applicable to human beings from Florida Statutes without substantive change in legal effect.

751.title: Review Under Open Government Sunset Review Act
751.description: Removes scheduled repeal of public records exemption for certain information contained in records documenting act of domestic violence or sexual violence which are submitted to agency by agency employee.

755.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-217, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7087 (Ch. 2013-226)
755.title: Public Records Exemption/School Food and Nutrition Service Program Participants
755.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of applicant for or participant in school food & nutrition program held by DACS, DCF, or DOE; provides for specified disclosure; provides for applicability; provides for legislative review & repeal of exemption under Open Government Sunset Review Act; provides for contingent effective date.

756.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7009 (Ch. 2013-250), CS/CS/SB 1076 (Ch. 2013-27), CS/SB 1096 (Ch. 2013-35), SB 1514 (Ch. 2013-45), CS/CS/SB 1664 (Ch. 2013-185), CS/CS/SB 1720 (Ch. 2013-51)
756.title: K-20 Education
756.description: Provides that Next Generation Sunshine State Standards include common core standards; revises middle grades promotion requirements; provides requirements for standard high school diploma & diploma designations; provides course & assessment requirements for diploma; provides requirements for statewide, standardized assessment program; provides for transition to common core assessments; provides requirements for industry certifications & funding therefor; revises funding for students based on completion of end-of-course assessments; revises certain calculations in FEFP & teacher bonuses; provides performance payments to schools based on student digital competency.

757.last_action: CS failed to pass; YEAS 51 NAYS 65, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1770 (Ch. 2013-60), SB 1850 (Ch. 2013-61)
757.title: Establishment of Clearinghouse Program within Citizens Property Insurance Corporation
757.description: Exempts Citizens Property Insurance Corporation from exchange of business limitations & restrictions when placing business with authorized insurers; restricts eligibility of risk for renewal policy issued by corporation under certain circumstances; requires creation of clearinghouse program within corporation; requires corporation to provide report to Legislature; provides conditions, requirements, limitations, & procedures applicable to offers of coverage with respect to applicants for coverage with corporation & existing policyholders of corporation, etc.

758.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1850 (Ch. 2013-61), CS/SB 1770 (Ch. 2013-60)
758.title: Public Records/Citizens Property Insurance Corporation Clearinghouse Program
758.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for proprietary business information provided to corporation's policyholder eligibility clearinghouse program by insurers with respect to identifying & selecting risks for offer of coverage; defines term "proprietary business information"; authorizes disclosure under specified conditions; provides for future review & repeal of exemption under OGSR Act; provides statement of public necessity.

760.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1516 (Ch. 2013-46), SB 1500 (Ch. 2013-40)
760.title: Corporate Income Tax
760.description: Provides for adoption of 2013 version of Internal Revenue Code; specifies treatment by this state of certain depreciation & expensing of assets that are allowed for federal income tax purposes; authorizes executive director of DOR to adopt emergency rules; provides for retroactive effect.

761.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1784 (Ch. 2013-222)
761.title: Inhibiting Encroachment Of Military Bases
761.description: Specifies functions of Military Base Protection Program; authorizes DEO to annually submit to Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund list of nonconservation lands to be acquired for purpose of buffering military base against encroachment; requires board of trustees to consider recommendations of Florida Defense Support Task Force; provides for applicability; authorizes additional uses of funds provided for program; authorizes board of trustees to acquire specified lands.

762.title: Cross-Over Youth
762.description: Creates pilot project to serve youth in common to DCF & DJJ; provides for selection of county for project; requires interested providers to submit proposals; requires reports to Governor & Legislature.

763.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 999 (Ch. 2013-92), CS/CS/SB 492 (Ch. 2013-172)
763.title: Tax Administration
763.description: Eliminates requirement for personal representative to file Florida estate tax return for decedents who die after December 31, 2012; provides for retroactive application; revises definition of term "phosphate-related expenses" to include additional uses for which county may expend phosphate tax proceeds; subjects dealer to monetary & criminal penalties for willful failure to collect certain taxes or fees after notice of duty to collect taxes or fees by DOR; deletes provisions relating to imposition of criminal penalties after notice by DOR of requirements to register as dealer or to collect taxes; makes technical & grammatical changes to provisions specifying penalties for making false or fraudulent return with intent to evade payment of tax or fee; defines term "person"; authorizes DOR to adopt rules relating to requirements for person to deposit cash, bond, or other security with department in order to ensure compliance with sales tax laws; subjects person to criminal penalties for willfully failing to register as dealer after notice by DOR; revises due date for funds collected by clerks of court to be transmitted to DOR; provides for retroactive application; revises maximum dollar amount of compromise authority that DOR may delegate to executive director.

764.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1768 (Ch. 2013-69)
764.title: OGSR Paratransit Services
764.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under the Open Government Sunset Review Act an exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information of applicant for or recipient of paratransit services; clarifies provisions.

765.last_action: Died in Local and Federal Affairs Committee
765.title: Local Business Taxes
765.description: Creates business classifications; requires counties & municipalities levying local business tax to use rate structure that applies rates within specified parameters; authorizes county or municipality that has not adopted business tax ordinance to adopt ordinance consistent with ch. 205, F.S.; requires that such ordinance be approved by specified vote of governing body of county; revises conditions, requirements, & limitations with respect to authority of governing body of county to levy business tax; provides that incorporated municipality may levy business tax by ordinance approved by specified vote of governing body; revises conditions & requirements with respect to authority of governing body of municipality to levy business tax; authorizes counties & municipalities sharing common territory to issue business tax receipts on behalf of each other; revises provisions relating to business tax classification method & rate structure; provides limitations & requirements with respect to amount of new revenue that county or municipality may realize as result of new business tax rate structure authorized by act.

766.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1852 (Ch. 2013-106)
766.title: Funding from the National Mortgage Settlement
766.description: Provides appropriation from General Revenue Fund to Florida Housing Finance Corporation to fund housing down payment assistance loans; provides distribution requirements; provides requirements for loan recipients; provides for loan forgiveness under certain conditions; provides appropriation from General Revenue Fund to Florida Housing Finance Corporation, Florida Prepaid Tuition Scholarship Program, state courts system, clerks of court, DCF, for certain purposes; provides appropriation from General Revenue Fund DEO to provide grant to Habitat for Humanity of Florida for certain purposes; provides requirements for Habitat for Humanity of Florida; provides financial audit reporting requirements; requires certain funds to be repaid by Habitat for Humanity of Florida to DFS for deposit in State Housing Trust Fund; authorizes Office of Attorney General to establish, coordinate, & promote advertising campaign for certain purposes; provides appropriation to Office of Attorney General for certain purposes; provides that certain funds appropriated in this act are not subject to reversion until specified date; provides contingent effective date. APPROPRIATION:

767.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1806 (Ch. 2013-70)
767.title: Total Maximum Daily Loads
767.description: Exempts specified rules adopted by DEP from ratification by Legislature.

768.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1808 (Ch. 2013-71)
768.title: Numeric Nutrient Criteria
768.description: Authorizes DEP to implement specified provisions to control nutrient load in state waters & implement specified nutrient standards; provides for deletion of specified rule from Florida Administrative Code; provides that specified numeric nutrient rules are subject to certain rule provisions & exempt from ratification by Legislature; directs department to establish certain numeric interpretations of the narrative nutrient criterion for certain estuaries & submit a specified report.

769.title: Transportation Facility Designations
769.description: Povidies honorary designations of various transportation facilities in specified counties; provides for erection of markers.

772.title: Sovereign Immunity
772.description: Revises requirements relating to waiver of sovereign immunity; requires judge to determine damages; provides certain damages be placed into trust; provides for distribution of damages in trust upon the death of a claimant; provides for periodic payment of damages; authorizes political subdivisions to insure for certain amounts to avoid claim bill; provides requirements with respect to such insurance; prohibits claim bill upon certain conditions; provides a remedy against insurers who act in bad faith; raises caps on damages for awards against local governments; provides for settlement above the cap on damages; provides for annual adjustment to the cap on damages against local governments; provides requirements for lobbyists of claim bills; removes a limitation on presenting claim to Legislature; limits ability to file claim bill; names provisions as "Florida Fair Claims Act"; provides for severability; provides for applicability.

773.title: Department of Highway Safety & Motor Vehicles
773.description: Provides that certain positions in HSMV are exempt from career service; revises provisions for certain commercial motor vehicles & transporters & shippers of hazardous materials; revises language relating to certain commercial motor vehicles not properly licensed & registered; revises provisions for transfer of ownership by operation of law when motor vehicle or mobile home is repossessed; amends provisions relating to manufacturers, distributors, & importers of motor vehicles; amends provisions relating to review of license suspension when driver had blood or breath alcohol at certain level or driver refused test of his or her blood or breath to determine alcohol level; provides appropriations. APPROPRIATION:

775.title: Residential Services for Children
775.description: Provides accreditation requirements for boarding schools; authorizes DCF to impose administrative sanctions or civil remedies when residential group care is being provided without license; requires background screening for certain boarding school personnel; requires boarding schools to follow standard school schedules; provides for fines; provides for appropriations from general revenue funds to DOH for certain health programs benefiting children; limits duty of officer or employee of law enforcement agency to provide notice to DCF of reasonable cause to suspect child abuse; limits duty of Central Abuse Hotline to electronically transfer certain calls & reports to county sheriff's office. APPROPRIATION:

777.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 4 (Ch. 2013-38), CS/SB 2 (Ch. 2013-36)
777.title: Public Records and Meetings
777.description: Creates exemption from public records requirements for written referrals & related records held by Commission on Ethics, Governor, Department of Law Enforcement, or state attorney; creates exemption for records relating to preliminary investigation held by Commission on Ethics; creates exemption from public meetings requirements for portions of proceedings of Commission on Ethics in which referrals are discussed or acted upon; provides for future repeal & legislative review of exemption under Open Government Sunset Review Act; provides statement of public necessity.

778.last_action: Chapter No. 2013-155, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 217 (Ch. 2013-139)
778.title: Pub. Rec./Money Services Businesses
778.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for payment instrument transaction information held by OFR; provides for specified access to such information; authorizes office to enter into information-sharing agreements & provide access to information contained in database to certain governmental agencies; requires a department or agency that receives confidential information to maintain confidentiality of information, except as otherwise required by court order; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity; provides contingent effective date.

780.title: Establishment of a Mental Health First Aid Training Program
780.description: Requires DCF to establish mental health first aid training program; provides course requirements & certification of instructors; provides for expiration of program.

782.title: OGSR Direct-support Organization for Department of Veterans' Affairs
782.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records & public meetings requirements for information identifying certain donors to DSO for DVA; specifies applicability of public meeting exemption.

783.title: OGSR Employment Discrimination Complaints
783.description: Saves from repeal under the Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records requirements for employment discrimination complaints & other records.

785.title: Education Capital Outlay
785.description: Revises provisions relating to amount & uses of certain state university fees; revises fees & revenues allowed to secure revenue bonds & debt; deletes university campus development agreements; provides requirement for university campus master plan; increases cap on funds university may use for certain purposes.

787.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1660 (Ch. 2013-50)
787.title: Quality Cancer Care & Research
787.description: Establishes Cancer Center of Excellence Award for providers that excel in providing cancer care & treatment in this state; requires Florida Cancer Control & Research Advisory Council & Biomedical Research Advisory Council to jointly develop performance measures, rating system, & rating standard in accordance with specified criteria for applicants to qualify for award; provides that award-winning cancer provider is granted preference in competitive solicitations for specified period of time; revises responsibilities of councils with regard to Cancer Center of Excellence Award program.

789.title: Ratification of Rules Implementing Total Maximum Daily Loads for Impaired Water Bodies
789.description: Ratifies specified DEP rules implementing total maximum daily loads for impaired water bodies for sole & exclusive purpose of satisfying any condition on effectiveness that requires ratification of any rule meeting any of specified thresholds for likely adverse impact or increase in regulatory costs.

790.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 247 (Ch. 2013-192), CS/CS/HB 437 (Ch. 2013-83), SB 1830 (Ch. 2013-72)
790.title: Ad Valorem Taxation
790.description: Provides that postmark date of commercial mail delivery service is considered date of filing for certain ad valorem applications or returns; allows certain ad valorem communications to be sent electronically in lieu of first-class mail; provides requirements & conditions applicable to such electronic communications; requires property appraiser to publish notices of date of tax roll certifications & extensions on property appraiser's website; provides that change of ownership for purposes of assessing property at just value does not apply to lessees entitled to homestead; extends time for appealing value adjustment board's denial of taxpayer's application to transfer prior homestead assessment limitations to new homestead; provides for taxation & assessment of bioproduction feedstocks & certain personal property; provides assessment methodology for structures used in production of bioproduction feedstocks; authorizes county to waive annual application requirement for reduction in assessed value of homestead property used to provide living quarters for parents or grandparents of owner or spouse of owner; requires property owner to notify property appraiser if reduction no longer applies.

791.title: Public Records/Student Learning Growth Data
791.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for student learning growth data that is educator-specific & personally identifies an educator which is held by DOE or school district for use in evaluation of educator; provides for limited duration of exemption; defines term "educator"; provides for retroactive effect of exemption; authorizes disclosure of such student learning growth data under specified conditions; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

792.title: Comprehensive Health Information System
792.description: Renames Florida Center for Health Information & Policy Analysis as Florida Health Information Transparency Initiative; revises functions that AHCA must perform to collect & disseminate health information & statistics; requires agency to implement transparency initiative; abolishes State Consumer Health Information & Policy Advisory Council.

793.title: Early Learning
793.description: Creates Office of Early Learning within Office of Independent Education & Parental Choice to administer school readiness program & VPK program at state level; revises provisions relating to VPK program; creates new part in school code relating to school readiness program, which includes duties of office & early learning coalitions, program requirements, eligibility & enrollment requirements, provider standards, & program funding; modifies organizational structure within DOE; repeals current law relating to school readiness.

794.title: Cost Recovery for Nuclear and Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle Power Plants
794.description: Revises provisions establishing alternative cost recovery mechanisms; revises provisions for calculation of carrying costs; provides identification of certain costs on customer bills; authorizes Public Service Commission to approve recovery of costs after federal licensure under certain conditions; requires commission to review certain proposed nuclear power plants.

795.title: Florida Health Choices Plus Program
795.description: Provides that employers who meet requirements of Florida Health Choices Program are eligible to enroll in Florida Health Choices Plus Program; requires participating employers to make defined contribution with certain conditions; provides that individuals & employees of enrolled employers are eligible to participate in program; provides criteria for products offered by program; creates Florida Health Choices Plus Program & provides enrollment requirements; requires individual contribution & provides for disenrollment; requires report to Governor & Legislature; creates task force; authorizes prepaid health clinic to offer certain hospital services; provides appropriations. 870.title: Joint Session for Purpose of Receiving Governor's Message
870.description: Calls for House of Representatives & Senate to convene in Joint Session at 11:00 a.m. on March 5, 2013, for purpose of receiving message from Governor.

871.title: Joint Legislative Task Force on Turkish and Florida Relations
871.description: Creates Joint Legislative Task Force on Turkish and Florida Relations.

872.title: Minimum Salaries for New and Experienced Full-Time Teachers in Public Schools
872.description: Proposes amendment to s. 1, Art. IX of State Constitution to set minimum salaries for new & experienced full-time teachers in public schools. By 2015, minimum salary for new full-time teacher in public school must be at least national average salary for new full-time teachers in public schools. By 2015, average salary for experienced full-time teacher in public school must be at least national average salary for experienced full-time teachers in public schools. Salary adjustments required by amendment are independent of employee benefits & must not result in decreased employee benefits. State, rather than school districts, must fund required salary increases.

873.title: Basic Rights
873.description: Proposes amendment to s. 2, Art. I of State Constitution to eliminate authority granted to Legislature by constitutional amendment that at time of adoption in 1926 allowed Legislature to regulate or eliminate real property rights of aliens ineligible for citizenship. As amended, State Constitution will state that all natural persons are equal before law & have inalienable right to acquire, possess, & protect property.

874.title: Voter Access Guarantee
874.description: Proposes creation of s. 8, Art. VI of State Constitution to guarantee the right to vote by absentee ballot or early voting within 30 days before general election.

875.title: Age Limits for Justices and Judges
875.description: Proposes amendment to Section 8 of Article V & creation of new section to Article XII of State Constitution to increase age after which justice or judge may no longer serve in judicial office, to provide for amendment to apply to justices & judges appointed on or after specified date.

876.title: Governor's Authority to Fill Vacancy in County Office
876.description: Proposes amendment to s.1, Art. IV of State Constitution to remove Governor's authority to fill, by appointment, vacancy in county office.

877.title: Postconviction Capital Case Procedures
877.description: Proposes amendment to Section 2 of Article V & creation of new section in Article XII of State Constitution to require procedures for postconviction or collateral review of capital cases resulting in sentence of death to be governed exclusively by, & to extent provided by, general law.

914.description: Provides for relief of Ronald Miller by City of Hollywood; provides for appropriation to compensate him for injuries sustained as result of negligence of City of Hollywood; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM:

915.title: Relief/Maricelly Lopez/City of North Miami
915.description: Provides for relief of Maricelly Lopez by City of North Miami; provides for appropriation to compensate Maricelly Lopez, individually & as personal representative of Estate of Omar Mieles, for wrongful death of her son, Omar Mieles, due to negligence of City of North Miami; provides limitation on payment of fees & costs. CLAIM:

923.title: Public Records/Identifying Information of Department of Health Personnel
923.description: Providing an exemption from public records requirements for certain identifying information of specific current and former personnel of the Department of Health and the spouses and children of such personnel, under specified circumstances; providing for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption under the Open Government Sunset Review Act; providing a statement of public necessity, etc.

924.title: Low-speed Vehicles
924.description: Authorizing the conversion of a vehicle titled or branded and registered as a low-speed vehicle to a golf cart; requiring the Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles to issue a decal, etc.

929.last_action: Died in Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 52 (Ch. 2013-58)
929.title: Use of Hand-held Wireless Communications Devices While Driving
929.description: Creating the "Florida Ban on Communicating While Driving Law"; defining the term "hand-held wireless communications device"; prohibiting the operation of a motor vehicle while using a hand-held wireless communications device for certain purposes; providing for points to be assessed against a driver license for the unlawful use of a hand-held wireless communications device within a school safety zone or unlawful use resulting in a crash, etc.

933.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 85 (Ch. 2013-223)
933.title: Public-private Partnerships
933.description: Authorizing certain public entities to contract for public service works with not-for-profit organizations; providing legislative findings and intent relating to the construction or improvement by private entities of facilities used predominantly for a public purpose; authorizing counties to enter into public-private partnership agreements for construction of roads under certain circumstances, etc.

935.title: Mail Order Sales
935.description: Revising the term "mail order sale" to specifically include sales of tangible personal property ordered by Internet; deleting certain provisions that specify dealer activities or other circumstances that subject mail order sales to this state's power to levy and collect the sales and use tax; providing that certain persons who make mail order sales and who have a substantial nexus with this state are subject to this state's power to levy and collect the sales and use tax if they engage in certain enumerated activities; creating a rebuttable presumption that a dealer is subject to the state's power to levy and collect the sales or use tax under specified circumstances, etc.

941.title: Employment Practices
941.description: Prohibiting an employer from using a job applicant's credit report or credit history to make certain hiring, compensation, or other employment decisions; providing specific situations where an employer may use such information; providing for a plaintiff to post a bond to indemnify the defendant for damages, including attorney fees, in certain situations, etc.

946.title: Florida Mental Health Act
946.description: Requiring the Department of Children and Families to convene a work group to review the Florida Mental Health Act to determine whether certain revisions are necessary; requiring the work group to submit a report to the Governor and the Legislature by a specified date, etc.

947.title: Filing False Documents Against Real or Personal Property
947.description: Prohibiting a person from filing or causing to be filed, with intent to defraud or harass another, a document relating to the ownership, transfer, or encumbrance of, or claim against, real or personal property, or any interest in real or personal property; establishing reclassified penalties for persons who commit the specified offenses a second or subsequent time when the person is a convicted offender who commits the specified offenses while incarcerated in a jail or participating in a community correctional program and when the victim of the offense is a public officer or employee or incurs financial losses under certain circumstances, etc.

957.title: Sun, Sea, and Smiles License Plates
957.description: Creating a Sun, Sea, and Smiles license plate; establishing an annual use fee for the plate; providing for the distribution of use fees received from the sale of such plates, etc.

958.title: Meetings of District School Boards
958.description: Requiring district school boards to convene at least one regular meeting each quarter during a school year during the evening hours and to create written criteria for convening such a meeting; providing that a district school board is deemed to be in compliance under certain circumstances, etc.

959.title: Self-defense
959.description: Authorizing a person to use deadly force, in the defense of property, to prevent the imminent commission of a forcible felony; directing the Department of Law Enforcement to collect, process, maintain, and disseminate information and data on all incidents concerning the alleged justifiable use of force in this state; requiring each law enforcement agency within the state to monthly report to the department all incidents and cases in which a claim regarding the justifiable use of force is raised, etc.

963.last_action: Died in Appropriations Subcommittee on Health and Human Services
963.title: Payment for Services Provided by Licensed Psychologists
963.description: Adding licensed psychologists to the list of health care providers who are protected by a limitations period from claims for overpayment being sought by health insurers or health maintenance organizations; adding licensed psychologists to the list of health care providers who are subject to a limitations period for submitting claims to health insurers or health maintenance organizations for underpayment; adding licensed psychologists to the list of health care providers who are eligible for direct payment for medical services by a health insurer under certain circumstances, etc.

964.title: Human Papillomavirus Vaccination
964.description: Requiring that information regarding human papillomavirus, its effects, and available vaccines be provided to parents or guardians of all children entering grade 6; requiring that the Department of Health approve information for dissemination by the Department of Education, etc.

965.title: Sentencing In Capital Felonies
965.description: Requiring that an advisory sentence of death be made by a unanimous recommendation of the jury after a defendant's conviction or adjudication of guilt for a capital felony or capital drug-trafficking felony; requiring the court to instruct the jury that, in order for the jury to recommend to the court that the death penalty be imposed, the jury must find that sufficient aggravating circumstances exist which outweigh any mitigating circumstances found to exist; requiring that the court provide a special verdict form for each aggravating circumstance found, etc.

966.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 461 (Ch. 2013-84)
966.title: Deaf and Hard-of-hearing Students
966.description: Requiring that a student's language and communication needs, including certain opportunities, be considered in the development of an individual education plan for a deaf or hard-of-hearing student; requiring the Department of Education to develop a model communication plan to be used in the development of an individual education plan for deaf or hard-of-hearing students; requiring the department to disseminate the model communication plan to each school district and provide technical assistance, etc.

971.title: Licensure Fee Exemptions for Military Veterans
971.description: Requiring that the Department of Health waive certain licensure fees for veterans; requiring that the department waive the initial application fee for veterans who apply for a radiological personnel certification; requiring the department to prescribe the form of the fee waiver; limiting the time period a veteran can apply to 24 months after honorable discharge; excluding a specific fee from the waiver, etc.

972.title: School Grades
972.description: Requiring that high schools be given a minimum percentage of credit for students who receive high school equivalency diplomas for purposes of calculating the school's graduation rate, beginning with the 2013-2014 school year, etc.

973.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 215 (Ch. 2013-21)
973.title: Children in Foster Care
973.description: Creating the "Quality-Parenting for Children in Foster Care Act"; establishing and providing for the application of a "reasonable and prudent parent" standard; providing for the application of the reasonable and prudent parent standard to independent living transition services; specifying that Department of Children and Families rules must reflect the considerations of the reasonable and prudent parent standard, etc.

975.title: John M. McKay Scholarships for Students with Disabilities Program
975.description: Revising the eligibility requirements for the John M. McKay scholarships for students with disabilities program; deleting the requirement that a student must have spent the prior school year in attendance at a Florida public school, etc.

978.title: Homestead Exemption
978.description: Authorizing a person to report to a local property appraiser a possible homestead exemption violation under certain circumstances; requiring that the tax collector pay a specified maximum reward to the reporting individual after the recovery of any back taxes, interest, or penalties; requiring associations for condominiums and cooperatives to provide a list of rented units to the property appraiser's office, etc.

981.title: Domestic Partners
981.description: Authorizing the clerk of the circuit court to collect a filing fee for domestic partner registrations; requiring that nursing homes allow a domestic partner access to his or her partner who is a resident and requiring that the domestic partner be allowed to meet with the families of other residents; establishing requirements for domestic partnership; providing that the act does not preempt the authority of a county or municipality to enact a domestic partnership ordinance unless in conflict with the act, etc.

982.title: Transportation Revenue Bond Trust Fund/Department of Transportation
982.description: Re-creating the Transportation Revenue Bond Trust Fund within the Department of Transportation without modification; abrogating provisions relating to the termination of the trust fund to conform, etc.

983.title: Transportation Governmental Bond Trust Fund/Department of Transportation
983.description: Re-creating the Transportation Governmental Bond Trust Fund within the Department of Transportation without modification; abrogating provisions relating to the termination of the trust fund, to conform, etc.

984.title: Termination of Trust Funds within the Department of Transportation
984.description: Terminating the Everglades Parkway Construction Trust Fund, the Jacksonville Transportation Authority Project Construction Trust Fund, and the Federal Law Enforcement Trust Fund within the Department of Transportation; providing for the transfer of any balances or revenues in the trust funds; requiring that the department pay outstanding debts or obligations of the trust funds; requiring that the Chief Financial Officer close out and remove the terminated funds from the state accounting systems, etc.

985.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/Department of State
985.description: Re-creating the Federal Grants Trust Fund within the Department of State without modification; abrogating provisions relating to the termination of the trust fund, to conform, etc.

986.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/Department of Economic Opportunity
986.description: Re-creating the Federal Grants Trust Fund within the Department of Economic Opportunity without modification; abrogating provisions relating to the termination of the trust fund, to conform, etc.

987.title: Clearing Funds Trust Fund/Department of State
987.description: Re-creating the Clearing Funds Trust Fund within the Department of State without modification; abrogating provisions relating to the termination of the trust fund, to conform, etc.

988.title: Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission Trust Funds
988.description: Deleting a restriction on an expenditure from the Lifetime Fish and Wildlife Trust Fund; renaming the Fish and Wildlife Habitat Program as the Land Acquisition Trust Fund; providing for the administration and funding of the Save the Manatee Trust Fund; providing for the administration and funding of the Invasive Plant Control Trust Fund, etc.

989.title: Florida Forever Program Trust Fund/Department of Environmental Protection
989.description: Terminating the Florida Forever Program Trust Fund within the Department of Environmental Protection; providing for the disposition of balances in, revenues of, and all outstanding appropriations of the trust fund; prescribing procedures for the termination of the trust fund; revising the designation of revenues from the disposal of lands in the Preservation 2000 program, etc.

990.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/Department of Management Services
990.description: Re-creating the Federal Grants Trust Fund within the Department of Management Services without modification; abrogating provisions relating to the termination of the trust fund, to conform, etc.

991.title: Mortgage Guaranty Trust Fund/Office of Financial Regulation
991.description: Re-creating the Mortgage Guaranty Trust Fund within the Office of Financial Regulation without modification; abrogating provisions relating to the termination of the trust fund, to conform, etc.

992.title: Capital Collateral Regional Counsel Trust Fund/Justice Administrative Commission
992.description: Re-creating the Capital Collateral Regional Counsel Trust Fund within the Justice Administrative Commission without modification; abrogating provisions relating to the scheduled termination of the trust fund, to conform, etc.

994.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 7007 (Ch. 2013-39)
994.title: Florida Small Business Development Center Network
994.description: Requiring the statewide director and the network to operate the program in compliance with federal laws and regulations and a Board of Governors regulation; requiring businesses that receive support services to participate in certain assessments; requiring the network to provide a match equal to certain state funding; requiring the statewide director to coordinate with the host institution to establish a pay-per-performance incentive; prohibiting certain regional small business development centers from receiving funds, etc.

999.title: Voter Registration
999.description: Authorizing the Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles to automatically register to vote or update a voter registration record of an eligible individual; requiring a driver license examiner to notify an applicant that, by applying for, renewing, or updating a driver license or identification card, the applicant is consenting to automatically register to vote or update his or her voter registration record; requiring that an applicant who fails to designate party affiliation be registered without party affiliation, etc.

1002.last_action: Died in Regulated Industries, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 15 (Ch. 2013-19)
1002.title: Protest Activities
1002.description: Prohibiting engaging in protest activities within a specified distance of the property line of the location of a funeral, burial, or memorial service; providing criminal penalties, etc.

1008.title: Cigarette Products of Nonsettling Manufacturers
1008.description: Imposing a fee on the sale, receipt, purchase, possession, consumption, handling, distribution, and use of nonsettling manufacturer cigarettes that are required to have a stamp affixed or stamp insignia applied to the package of cigarettes on which tax is otherwise required to be paid; requiring the Division of Alcoholic Beverages and Tobacco of the Department of Business and Professional Regulation to post a directory listing of all settling manufacturers that have provided accurate certifications of their products in order to calculate their payments under the tobacco settlement agreement for the relevant year on the Internet website of the division, etc.

1009.last_action: Died in Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1009.title: State Debtors
1009.description: Directing the Department of State to publish on its website a list of persons owing money to the state; requiring that the Chief Financial Officer or the governing body of a county, municipality, or special district withhold salary payments that would otherwise be paid to an elected official when that official owes a debt or fine to the state, etc.

1018.last_action: Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 487 (Ch. 2013-85)
1018.title: Freemasonry License Plates
1018.description: Creating a Freemasonry license plate; establishing an annual use fee for the plate; providing for the distribution of annual use fees received from the sale of such plates, etc.

1019.title: State University Fee Exemptions
1019.description: Citing this act as the "Student Global Economic Education Act;" providing an exemption from the payment of tuition for students enrolled in certain foreign language courses offered at a state university, etc.

1021.title: Criminal Prosecution of Juveniles
1021.description: Providing additional circumstances for the discretionary direct filing of charges against certain juveniles; providing criteria for determining when a case against a juvenile should be recommended to the court to be transferred for criminal prosecution; providing criteria for consideration of a child's request to an adult court to return a criminal case to the juvenile justice system, etc.

1026.last_action: Died in Appropriations Subcommittee on Finance and Tax
1026.title: Taxes on Prepaid Calling Arrangements
1026.description: Revising the definition of "prepaid calling arrangement" to clarify and update which services are included under that definition; providing for retroactive application, etc.

1029.title: Retirement
